objects.author: robert@affectdigital.com
objects.html_title: Using Co-op to Maximize Your Ad Dollars!
objects.label: Using Co-op to Maximize Your Ad Dollars!

meta.post_summary: Does your business model utilize specific distributors or vendors for various types of products? Chances are you have co-op dollars that can be used towards the marketing of your business. With Q4 right around the corner, the time is now to either use it or lose it!
meta.html_title: Using Co-op to Maximize Your Ad Dollars!
meta.post_body:
Does your business model utilize specific distributors or vendors for various types of products? Chances are you have co-op dollars that can be used towards the marketing of your business. With Q4 right around the corner, the time is now to either use it or lose it!

Most business owners would welcome the thought of expanding their own advertising budget with the help of their manufacturers reimbursing them for part of the cost. Co-op advertising is a partnership between a retailer and a manufacturer to promote brand-name products in the local marketplace. Through the use of co-op programs, manufacturers typically subsidize anywhere from 50 to 100 percent of retailer advertising costs. Co-op funds can be used in many different forms: traditional media, digital advertising, social media advertising, and more!

When I speak with business owners, there are two primary reasons as to why people do not take advantage of their co-op advertising funds even if they know they exist:

First, they feel they do not need to advertise. The issue with this is even the strongest brands will lose customers over time through relocation, competition, attrition, and many other factors. The most successful businesses are typically proactive about replacing this revenue base rather than reactive. For these types of business owners, co-op advertising can be the perfect start to developing an advertising and marketing strategy to funnel in new leads and customers to not only sustain their business but also grow!

The second most common reason I hear is that processing their co-op paperwork can be a hassle and an extreme headache. Some manufacturers purposefully make the co-op process tedious in hopes that the business owner will not spend their co-op funds. For example, some may require their logo be a certain size or may require specific wording in the advertisement. Who has the time to keep up with these varying restrictions from manufacturer to manufacturer? What if I told you there was a program where the business owner doesn’t have to worry about a single step of the reimbursement process?

Here at Affect Digital Media, we have a dedicated co-op specialist who will ensure the spending of your co-op advertising funds is a seamless process and the business owner doesn’t have to oversee it! They will assist in developing potential advertisements that follow the manufacturer’s guidelines, getting pre-approval from the manufacturer on ad creative, getting the billing processed to ensure you get the proper reimbursement, and any other step of the co-op process that is required. We take the stresses of the process off your plate so you can focus on what you do best – making your customers happy.

So don’t leave money on the table AGAIN this year. Take advantage of the advertising you have earned on your manufacturer’s dollar for the inventory you have purchased from them this year. Not using your co-op advertising funds is the equivalent of turning away new leads. 

We at ADM can help with:

•Co-op Accrual Research

•Brand Advertising Opportunities

•Pre-approved Co-op Design

•Advertising Approval Service

•Co-op Claim Documentation

Ready to get started? Click on the button below for a free co-op consultation on how ADM can help uncover hidden ad dollars for you today!
meta.meta_description: Co-op advertising is a partnership between a retailer and a manufacturer to promote brand-name products in the local marketplace.  By utilizing co-op advertising, you can increase your inbound leads resulting in new leads and customer.  Let us help you find additional ad dollars for your marketing!

objects.author: jtholmes@affectdigital.com
objects.html_title: Jennifer Love Promoted To Vice President Of Sales
objects.label: Jennifer Love Promoted To Vice President Of Sales

meta.post_summary: Our team is excited to announce that Jennifer Love has been promoted to the position of Vice President Of Sales. This change officially unifies all ADM sales efforts in all markets under Jennifer.
meta.html_title: Jennifer Love Promoted To Vice President Of Sales
meta.post_body:
Our team is excited to announce that Jennifer Love has been promoted to the position of Vice President Of Sales. This change officially unifies all ADM sales efforts in all markets under Jennifer.

Jennifer brings a wealth of experience to her new role. A veteran of Digital Advertising and promotions, Jennifer has nearly a decade of experience helping local businesses reach their marketing goals and compete in an ever-changing marketplace. Jennifer 

has steadily risen through the industry, starting out as a local digital media account executive in 2010, joining ADM in 2012 and promoted to Regional Sales Director in 

2013. In this position, Jennifer gained national recognition when she finished runner-up to the Lo

cal Media Associations Digital Sales Manager of the Year in 2014.

"I can't overstate the value of Jennifer's contributions to the culture of success here at ADM. Her positive attitude, unique 

ability to make complex concepts seem simple and  demonstrable sales leadership continues to motivate the team she leads and her coworkers."  said Jason Holmes, President of Affect Digital Media.

"Given ADMs continued growth, local market leadership and the success of our customers, it only made sense to elevate Jennifer into this new position." continued Holmes.

Jennifer is a native Texan. She was born and raised near Houston and has lived in Dallas, Lubbock and had a short stint in Arizona. Jennifer has an extensive sales and marketing background with experience in direct consumer marketing and as a real estate agent.

Jennifer resides in Inez with her husband and high school sweetheart, Bobby, and their young son, Cohen.
meta.meta_description: Jennifer Love promoted to Vice President of Sales at Affect Digital Media in Victoria, Longview and Corpus Christi.

objects.author: jtholmes@affectdigital.com
objects.html_title: ADM Welcomes Paige Leopold
objects.label: ADM Welcomes Paige Leopold

meta.post_summary: Our team is happy to announce that Paige Leopold has joined Affect Digital Media as an Account Executive.
meta.html_title: ADM Welcomes Paige Leopold
meta.post_body:
Our team is happy to announce that Paige Leopold has joined Affect Digital Media as an Account Executive.

In her new role, Paige will assist local South Texas  businesses in their marketing and promotional efforts and help ensure that ADM customers reap the best possible benefit from their marketing budgets.

Prior to joining ADM, Paige served as an Account Executive with Beeville Publishing Company, Inc. Before her stint as an account executive, Paige was a designer with Advocate Digital Media (now Affect Digital Media) where she was responsible for website design, advertising creative, social media management as well as related creative and services.

"I'm very excited to be taking on this new role. When I learned of the opportunity to rejoin ADM as an Account Executive, I knew that this was the right fit for my skills, aptitude and the next logical step in my career. Coming back to Affect Digital feels like coming home and I can't wait to get started!" Leopold said.

Paige is a South Texas native having grown up in Hallettsville, TX and holds a Bachelor's degree in Fine Art from Texas State University with a minor in Business Administration. 

Paige is engaged to be married in October of this year and resides in Victoria, TX.

Before her stint as an account executive, Paige was a designer with Advocate Digital Media (now Affect Digital Media) where she was responsible for website design, advertising creative, social media management as well as related creative and services.

"I'm very excited to be taking on this new role. When I learned of the opportunity to rejoin ADM as an Account Executive, I knew that this was the right fit for my skills, aptitude and the next logical step in my career. Coming back to Affect Digital feels like coming home and I can't wait to get started!" Leopold said.

Paige is a South Texas native having grown up in Hallettsville, TX and holds a Bachelor's degree in Fine Art from Texas State University with a minor in Business Administration. 

Paige is engaged to be married in October of this year and resides in Victoria, TX.

meta.post_summary: We are thrilled to announce that Robert Royer has joined the Affect Digital Media team as Director Of Client Success.
meta.html_title: ADM Welcomes Robert Royer As Director Of Client Success
meta.featured_image_alt_text: Robert Royer, Director Of Client Success
meta.meta_description: Robert Royer Joins ADM as Director Of Client Success
meta.post_body:
We are thrilled to announce that Robert Royer has joined the Affect Digital Media team as Director Of Client Success.

In this new role, Robert will focus on ensuring that all ADM customers are successful in their marketing and customer acquisition efforts. Robert brings a wealth of experience and passion to his new role.

Prior to joining ADM, Robert served as the Digital Sales Manager with M. Roberts Media in the South Texas Region. His passion for digital marketing led him to this digitally focused role in early 2018 after a three year stint in publishing with the same firm.

"I'm beyond excited to take on this new role with Affect Digital Media. Anyone who knows me knows how passionate I am about marketing, the success of my clients and all things digital," Royer said. "ADM has been the market leader in digital advertising and promotions in South Texas for years. It was a natural fit for me to join this award winning team!"

Robert is a South Texas native and holds a Bachelors degree in Business Administration from UHV. Robert also holds Google AdWords Certifications in Search and Display advertising.

Robert lives in Victoria, TX with his wife Averi and son Michael.

--

Affect Digital Media is a full service digital advertising agency offering targeted digital campaigns, responsive website design and optimization, industry leading search engine strategies and social media plans for a variety of clients. The agency handles all forms of advertising and marketing, including branding, creative design, video production, outdoor, online, TV, radio, and print media planning and buying. Learn more at www.AffectDigital.com

objects.html_title: ADM to Present at Longview Chamber's 2018 Business Solutions Conference
objects.label: ADM to Present at Longview Chamber's 2018 Business Solutions Conference

meta.post_summary: Affect Digital Media, a full-service advertising agency located in Longview, is proud to return as the presenting sponsor of the Longview Chamber of Commerce’s Business Solutions Conference 2018. ADM leaders Jason Holmes and Amanda Bowlby will be presenting at the event on the Internet of Things and social media.
meta.html_title: ADM to Present at Longview Chamber's 2018 Business Solutions Conference
meta.meta_description: Affect Digital Media to serve as presenting sponsor and presenter at the Longview Chamber of Commerce's  2018 Business Solutions Conference.
meta.post_body:
Affect Digital Media, a full-service advertising agency located in Longview, is proud to return as the presenting sponsor of the Longview Chamber of Commerce’s Business Solutions Conference 2018. ADM leaders Jason Holmes and Amanda Bowlby will be presenting at the event on the Internet of Things and social media.

 

 

 

 

The conference is scheduled for May 3 at the Maude Cobb Convention Center. East Texas industry leaders are invited to attend to gain the latest insights, build lasting connections and take advantage of the great educational sessions.

  

“This is a fantastic opportunity to partner with the Longview Chamber of Commerce to help educate the business community on the latest trends and developments in advertising and digital marketing, “Jennifer Love, Digital Sales Director for Affect Digital Media, said.

 

Attendees for the one-day event are invited to begin arriving at 7:30 a.m. for the power networking, followed by the Small Business Awards and Leadership Longview Graduation breakfast at 8 a.m. The first round of business education sessions start at 9:45 a.m. There are six focused tracks of educational sessions: Advertising & Marketing, Leadership & Communication, Health & Wellbeing, Cyber Security, Employment Law and Financial.

 

“With topics ranging from getting online with Google to managing cyber risks, these one hour sessions will be packed with timely and powerful takeaways, “ Love said. “ADM is proud to sponsor the advertising and marketing track of educational sessions and will be presenting on social media, content marketing and the Internet of Things.”

 

The focus of the luncheon this year will be focused on the HealthyView initiative and will be held from 12:15 to 1:30 p.m. Seminars will continue following the luncheon until 4:15. The conference will conclude with power networking until 5 p.m. Learn more and register now to attend at LongviewChamber.com or call Leska Parker at 903-918-1546.

 

“At Affect Digital Media, we want our clients to be informed on the shifting media landscape. By partnering on this conference, we feel we are sharing emerging trends not only with our clients, but also with business owners in the area that can greatly benefit from learning more about the landscape,“ Love said. To learn more about the services provided by ADM, visit www.affectdigital.com

 

Ready to get started? Complete the form below for a free consultation on how ADM can help your business thrive!

body.value: Geo-Fencing Explained!

body.html:
Location Based Advertising

You are probably familiar with Geo-targeted digital advertising. Basic Geo-targeting delivers digital advertising to consumers in specific locations. Generally these are campaigns and ad units targeted to people living in certain cities or neighborhoods. Perhaps a certain zip code. Geo-Fencing takes this concept a step further.

 

Geo-Fencing Made Simple

Modern smartphones collect and distribute data about us constantly. One of the most valuable pieces of data to marketers is the exact location of a given target customer. Location can indicate interest more than other types of data. Modern smartphones provide extremely accurate GPS functions. In-turn, this data becomes available to marketers like us in real time.

For instance, if your store sells mattresses it would make sense to target consumers that are visiting or have visited stores that also sell mattresses. Geo-Fencing makes this possible and can help local businesses win more customers.

 

Components Of A Successful Geo-Fencing Campaign

  • The Targeting Zone: This is the location you want to target. You want to deliver your advertising message to people that are either currently visiting or have recently visited this location. The Target Zone can be a specific address or multiple addresses.
  • The Message: This is your offer or the advertising unit you want to deliver to people in the target zone.
  • The Conversion Zone: This is the where you measure the effectiveness of this campaign. When a person that has been in the target zone is delivered your message and then visits your store this is a conversion. Like the Target Zone, the Conversion Zone can be an exact address, multiple addresses or any location specified on a map.

 

Pitfalls Of Geo-Fencing Campaigns

  • Relying On Singular Tactics: Geo-Fencing is an excellent tactic to incorporate into an overall campaign strategy. However, Geo-Fencing shouldn’t be the only tactic employed. Search retargeting, site retargeting, a strong social media strategy and other tactics should be included in any successful campaign.
  • Poor Technology Partners: Geo-Fencing is a hot topic right now. However, many providers haven’t invested in high quality technology platforms that allow truly address specific targeting.
  • Poor Creative Messaging: Your creative is also important. Consumers have short attention spans and you’re competing with multiple advertising messages. Your creative must be on point and relevant.

 

Ready to use this tactic in your digital advertising approach? Click the button below for a free consultation from one of our consultants.

 

{{cta('4239cfdd-d633-44a6-ae23-760beaacbdb6')}}

Yet many small businesses struggle to achieve successful digital campaigns with sustainable results. This occurs because they are missing one or more core digital essentials.
meta.html_title: Digital Essentials Every Small Business Needs
meta.meta_description: Get the digital essentials from ADM, including a responsive website, social media management, AdWords, business directory management and reputation management.
meta.post_body:
Having a small business digital marketing strategy is essential in this day and age for attracting, engaging AND converting your audience. Yet many small businesses struggle to achieve successful digital campaigns with sustainable results. This occurs because they are missing one or more core digital essentials.

 

 

Our ADM Essentials package was created to make your digital efforts comprehensive and seamless across the board! 

 

 

 

We know the temptation is there to try to save money and handle some of these digital assets on your own! body.value: Geo-Fencing Explained!

body.html:
Location Based Advertising

You are probably familiar with Geo-targeted digital advertising. Basic Geo-targeting delivers digital advertising to consumers in specific locations. Generally these are campaigns and ad units targeted to people living in certain cities or neighborhoods. Perhaps a certain zip code. Geo-Fencing takes this concept a step further.

 

Geo-Fencing Made Simple

Modern smartphones collect and distribute data about us constantly. One of the most valuable pieces of data to marketers is the exact location of a given target customer. Location can indicate interest more than other types of data. Modern smartphones provide extremely accurate GPS functions. In-turn, this data becomes available to marketers like us in real time.

For instance, if your store sells mattresses it would make sense to target consumers that are visiting or have visited stores that also sell mattresses. Geo-Fencing makes this possible and can help local businesses win more customers.

 

Components Of A Successful Geo-Fencing Campaign

  • The Targeting Zone: This is the location you want to target. You want to deliver your advertising message to people that are either currently visiting or have recently visited this location. The Target Zone can be a specific address or multiple addresses.
  • The Message: This is your offer or the advertising unit you want to deliver to people in the target zone.
  • The Conversion Zone: This is the where you measure the effectiveness of this campaign. When a person that has been in the target zone is delivered your message and then visits your store this is a conversion. Like the Target Zone, the Conversion Zone can be an exact address, multiple addresses or any location specified on a map.

 

Pitfalls Of Geo-Fencing Campaigns

  • Relying On Singular Tactics: Geo-Fencing is an excellent tactic to incorporate into an overall campaign strategy. However, Geo-Fencing shouldn’t be the only tactic employed. Search retargeting, site retargeting, a strong social media strategy and other tactics should be included in any successful campaign.
  • Poor Technology Partners: Geo-Fencing is a hot topic right now. However, many providers haven’t invested in high quality technology platforms that allow truly address specific targeting.
  • Poor Creative Messaging: Your creative is also important. Consumers have short attention spans and you’re competing with multiple advertising messages. Your creative must be on point and relevant.

 

Ready to use this tactic in your digital advertising approach? Click the button below for a free consultation from one of our consultants.

 

{{cta('4239cfdd-d633-44a6-ae23-760beaacbdb6')}}

objects.html_title: Advanced Dynamic Targeting
objects.label: Advanced Dynamic Targeting

meta.post_summary: Turnkey Solution for Auto Industry
meta.html_title: Advanced Dynamic Targeting
meta.meta_description: Advanced dynamic targeting is explained in the latest blog from Affect Digital Media.
meta.post_body:
Turnkey Solution for Auto Industry 

ADT is a turnkey solution to dynamically serve ads to your target market as they enter the research phase of buying a car.

Personalized ads are served in real-time for specific users based on the keywords they search and the contextual content they read.

 

What makes ADT different from other Dynamic Targeting providers? 

  • Only dynamic creative solution for upper-funnel purchasing activity
  • No integration with inventory software is required
  • Dynamically serve ads based on keywords searched and contextual content read
  • No site visit is required to serve dynamic ads
  • When user clicks on dynamic ad they are taken to your VDP
  • Customizable fields within dynamic creative ad template
  • True 1:1 marketing, a dynamic creative for a dynamic audience

*

 

User can interact with the ad unit and the creative will change in real-time based on vehicles interacted within the carousel.

 

 

Ready to engage ADT? Fill out the form below and we'll be in touch!

objects.html_title: What? ADM Can Help Me With Promo Products?
objects.label: What? ADM Can Help Me With Promo Products?

meta.post_summary: What? ADM Can Help Me Pick Out Promo Items? Yes indeed! Not only are we a Google Partner and team of digital experts, but also we offer all the services of a full-service advertising firm. Whether you are an ADM agency client or not, we can help you select the right promotional product for next meeting, trade show, event, chamber ribbon cutting or product launch!
meta.html_title: What? ADM Can Help Me With Promo Products?
meta.meta_description: Determining the right promotional product for the right end user can be challenging. ADM takes the guesswork out of the process and helps our customers to determine the very best item at the very best price.
meta.post_body:
What? ADM Can Help Me Pick Out Promo Items? Yes indeed! Not only are we a Google Partner and team of digital experts, but also we offer all the services of a full-service advertising firm. Whether you are an ADM agency client or not, we can help you select the right promotional product for next meeting, trade show, event, chamber ribbon cutting or product launch!

Our firm can work with your budget and provide solid recommendations, as well as provide samples to take the guesswork out of the decision. With years of experience in event marketing, we know what works! We can also help design table displays, logo tablecloths, retractable banners, brochures, business cards and more for you! So, don’t wait until right before your next event – plan for the long-term and make sure your event presence stands above the competition.

 

Here are a couple tips to keep in mind when narrowing down your options:

1. Think About the Event. Is the event a trade show? Conference tote bags would be a great solution! With so much paperwork given out at these events, bags are very valuable and have a great shelf life during and after the event.


2. Think About the End User. Know your customer. Think about their typical demographics – male or female? Middle or higher income? Their industry/business? Their interests? Once you narrow down the specifics about your current and target customers, your promo product decision gets much easier. Busy on the go, but never without your phone? Then the adhesive mobile phone wallets help hold what's valuable right on the back of your phone! Interested in a healthy lifestyle? Then these fruit-infused tumblers make a great fit!
                         

3. Think Long Term. When selecting your item, what would be something the user would find beneficial to say, keep on their desk at work? Or, maybe a cap or apparel, which is a higher investment, but can be seen years after the customer or prospect received it. You want to keep your company/your brand top-of-mind, so what promo product fits that need. This mood coloring changing cup would certainly stay on my desk to keep me hydrated AND entertained!
4. Think Handy and Useful! No one wants to waste precious marketing dollars on an item that is just going in the wastebasket. So think of items that will be of use – thumb drives, a heavy/metal pen, magnetic clip for the fridge. Also don’t be too scared to do something a little fun. We think these handy highlighters are quite attention grabbing! Also, in the fun category and useful - a figet spinner pen!
 

5. Think Ahead. Most promo items we order take one to two weeks to arrive. Some custom items might take longer, so make sure you start early so you don’t encounter rush fees for printing and or shipping! With the thousands of products out there, you need the right team working for you and providing solid recommendations that don’t break the bank, but break through the clutter.

 

Many local tradeshows and events are just around the corner, so now is the time to get those orders placed. The more lead-time we receive, the more vendor outlets we can investigate to get you even better deals! Call ADM today at 361-333-8030 to discuss your needs or complete the form below and we’ll be in touch!

What? ADM Can Help Me Pick Out Promo Items? Yes indeed! Not only are we a Google Partner and team of digital experts, but also we offer all the services of a full-service advertising firm. Whether you are an ADM agency client or not, we can help you select the right promotional product for next meeting, trade show, event, chamber ribbon cutting or product launch!

Our firm can work with your budget and provide solid recommendations, as well as provide samples to take the guesswork out of the decision. With years of experience in event marketing, we know what works! We can also help design table displays, logo tablecloths, retractable banners, brochures, business cards and more for you! So, don’t wait until right before your next event – plan for the long-term and make sure your event presence stands above the competition.

 

Here are a couple tips to keep in mind when narrowing down your options:

1. Think About the Event. Is the event a trade show? Conference tote bags would be a great solution! With so much paperwork given out at these events, bags are very valuable and have a great shelf life during and after the event.


2. Think About the End User. Know your customer. Think about their typical demographics – male or female? Middle or higher income? Their industry/business? Their interests? Once you narrow down the specifics about your current and target customers, your promo product decision gets much easier. Busy on the go, but never without your phone? Then the adhesive mobile phone wallets help hold what's valuable right on the back of your phone! Interested in a healthy lifestyle? Then these fruit-infused tumblers make a great fit!
                         

3. Think Long Term. When selecting your item, what would be something the user would find beneficial to say, keep on their desk at work? Or, maybe a cap or apparel, which is a higher investment, but can be seen years after the customer or prospect received it. You want to keep your company/your brand top-of-mind, so what promo product fits that need. This mood coloring changing cup would certainly stay on my desk to keep me hydrated AND entertained!
4. Think Handy and Useful! No one wants to waste precious marketing dollars on an item that is just going in the wastebasket. So think of items that will be of use – thumb drives, a heavy/metal pen, magnetic clip for the fridge. Also don’t be too scared to do something a little fun. We think these handy highlighters are quite attention grabbing! Also, in the fun category and useful - a figet spinner pen!
 

5. Think Ahead. Most promo items we order take one to two weeks to arrive. Some custom items might take longer, so make sure you start early so you don’t encounter rush fees for printing and or shipping! With the thousands of products out there, you need the right team working for you and providing solid recommendations that don’t break the bank, but break through the clutter.

 

Many local tradeshows and events are just around the corner, so now is the time to get those orders placed. The more lead-time we receive, the more vendor outlets we can investigate to get you even better deals! Call ADM today at 361-333-8030 to discuss your needs or complete the form below and we’ll be in touch!

body.value: Geo-Fencing Explained!

body.html:
Location Based Advertising

You are probably familiar with Geo-targeted digital advertising. Basic Geo-targeting delivers digital advertising to consumers in specific locations. Generally these are campaigns and ad units targeted to people living in certain cities or neighborhoods. Perhaps a certain zip code. Geo-Fencing takes this concept a step further.

 

Geo-Fencing Made Simple

Modern smartphones collect and distribute data about us constantly. One of the most valuable pieces of data to marketers is the exact location of a given target customer. Location can indicate interest more than other types of data. Modern smartphones provide extremely accurate GPS functions. In-turn, this data becomes available to marketers like us in real time.

For instance, if your store sells mattresses it would make sense to target consumers that are visiting or have visited stores that also sell mattresses. Geo-Fencing makes this possible and can help local businesses win more customers.

 

Components Of A Successful Geo-Fencing Campaign

  • The Targeting Zone: This is the location you want to target. You want to deliver your advertising message to people that are either currently visiting or have recently visited this location. The Target Zone can be a specific address or multiple addresses.
  • The Message: This is your offer or the advertising unit you want to deliver to people in the target zone.
  • The Conversion Zone: This is the where you measure the effectiveness of this campaign. When a person that has been in the target zone is delivered your message and then visits your store this is a conversion. Like the Target Zone, the Conversion Zone can be an exact address, multiple addresses or any location specified on a map.

 

Pitfalls Of Geo-Fencing Campaigns

  • Relying On Singular Tactics: Geo-Fencing is an excellent tactic to incorporate into an overall campaign strategy. However, Geo-Fencing shouldn’t be the only tactic employed. Search retargeting, site retargeting, a strong social media strategy and other tactics should be included in any successful campaign.
  • Poor Technology Partners: Geo-Fencing is a hot topic right now. However, many providers haven’t invested in high quality technology platforms that allow truly address specific targeting.
  • Poor Creative Messaging: Your creative is also important. Consumers have short attention spans and you’re competing with multiple advertising messages. Your creative must be on point and relevant.

 

Ready to use this tactic in your digital advertising approach? Click the button below for a free consultation from one of our consultants.

 

{{cta('4239cfdd-d633-44a6-ae23-760beaacbdb6')}}

objects.html_title: Win New Business With A Modern Video Strategy
objects.label: Win New Business With A Modern Video Strategy

meta.post_summary: On March 20, ADM, this area's only Google Partner, hosted a group of business owners and area leaders at our Victoria office to hear directly from Google staff on the latest developments in video.
meta.html_title: Win New Business With A Modern Video Strategy
meta.meta_description: The latest tactics to deliver video to your ideal audience is explained in the latest blog from Affect Digital Media.
meta.post_body:
On March 20, ADM, this area's only Google Partner, hosted a group of business owners and area leaders at our Victoria office to hear directly from Google staff on the latest developments in video. 

Speaker Bartosz Krupiczojc, Regional Product Specialist, Performance Video for YouTube, started us off, focusing on the topic of taking video from attention to action and how drive measurable results. 

Highlights from Bartosz: Video matters. Video is a richer and deeper medium to move people. Search captures people. Video moves people.

 

He shared a brand case study of Purple® Mattress and how they differentiate themselves. By combining humor and science, they were able to clearly demonstrate what makes their mattresses so special. 

 

Video compliments your campaign. Even strong search campaigns miss many undecided shoppers.

So, how can you win the attention and drive performance?

Three Keys for Video Performance

  1. Scale and precision – reach the right people based on their intent
  2. Win their attention in a low-attention world
  3. Taking action and convert into measurable results

 

Scale and Precision

YouTube has 1.5 billion global monthly viewers watching over 1 hour per day on mobile phones! They have the viewership to find new customers for you at scale.

Advertisers like you don’t want to reach everyone – you want to reach the RIGHT people – that high-intent audience - in the moments that matter. Since users are spending their time on mobile, ADM can leverage Google Maps, Google Search, Google Play, YouTube, etc. to determine better intent. This means new and improved targeting. With life events, we can reach individuals during major milestones like getting married or moving. Consumer patterns let us reach people with frequent purchasing patterns like convenience store shoppers, frequent restaurant goers, etc.

 

Search + YouTube = Custom Intent Audiences

Target people with video ads on YouTube after they’ve typed specific keywords on Google! ADM strongly recommends implementing this strategy. We will apply best practices for this custom intent audience, identifying keyword themes to deliver to specific audience segments.

Does this seem a bit complicated? That’s what we are here for! Let ADM handle your bidding, keyword planning and handle the measurement by providing solid reporting. As a Google Partner, that’s our role. Helping to drive big results by using the right tactics. 

Speaker Ryan Knowles, Global Product Lead, Performance Video shared about driving attention in a low-attention mobile world. We know our drop in attention span has led to more competition than ever before.

 

Stats to Note:

80% of users multitask on another device while watching TV.

7 in 10 teens watch 3+ hours of mobile video per day and 2x more YouTube + Netflix than cable.

With society cutting the cord, the solution is clear where your video needs to live. YouTube ads are a full sight and sound pitch for your business to a viewer who’s leaning in to watch. 95% of YouTube ads play in-view and with the sound on! Obviously the more attention your brand receives on this platform, the more efficient results you will see.

With location extensions for TrueView ads, you can drive clicks right from a video to do actions like Get Directions, Read Reviews, Call the Business, See Store Hours and more.

 

Did you know you could track online to offline conversions/visits to your location? You can do this with store visits tracking. It tells us how many people viewed your YouTube ad visited your location.

 

As always, we are here to answer your questions. As Google Partners, we can help you take advantage of YouTube, taking the viewer from attention to action.

Ready to use these tactics in your digital video campaigns? Click the button below for a free consultation from one of our consultants.

 

{{cta('15d68cad-f4e2-450f-8dcf-9a7f235d59d6')}}

Obviously the more attention your brand receives on this platform, the more efficient results you will see.

With location extensions for TrueView ads, you can drive clicks right from a video to do actions like Get Directions, Read Reviews, Call the Business, See Store Hours and more.

 

Did you know you could track online to offline conversions/visits to your location? You can do this with store visits tracking. It tells us how many people viewed your YouTube ad visited your location.

 

As always, we are here to answer your questions. As Google Partners, we can help you take advantage of YouTube, taking the viewer from attention to action.

Ready to use these tactics in your digital video campaigns? Click the button below for a free consultation from one of our consultants.

objects.title: Win New Business With A Modern Video Strategy

body.value: Win New Business With A Modern Video Strategy

body.html:
On March 20, ADM, this area's only Google Partner, hosted a group of business owners and area leaders at our Victoria office to hear directly from Google staff on the latest developments in video. 

Speaker Bartosz Krupiczojc, Regional Product Specialist, Performance Video for YouTube, started us off, focusing on the topic of taking video from attention to action and how drive measurable results. 

Highlights from Bartosz: Video matters. Video is a richer and deeper medium to move people. Search captures people. Video moves people.

 

He shared a brand case study of Purple® Mattress and how they differentiate themselves. By combining humor and science, they were able to clearly demonstrate what makes their mattresses so special. 

 

Video compliments your campaign. Even strong search campaigns miss many undecided shoppers.

So, how can you win the attention and drive performance?

Three Keys for Video Performance

  1. Scale and precision – reach the right people based on their intent
  2. Win their attention in a low-attention world
  3. Taking action and convert into measurable results

 

Scale and Precision

YouTube has 1.5 billion global monthly viewers watching over 1 hour per day on mobile phones! They have the viewership to find new customers for you at scale.

Advertisers like you don’t want to reach everyone – you want to reach the RIGHT people – that high-intent audience - in the moments that matter. Since users are spending their time on mobile, ADM can leverage Google Maps, Google Search, Google Play, YouTube, etc. to determine better intent. This means new and improved targeting. With life events, we can reach individuals during major milestones like getting married or moving. Consumer patterns let us reach people with frequent purchasing patterns like convenience store shoppers, frequent restaurant goers, etc.

 

Search + YouTube = Custom Intent Audiences

Target people with video ads on YouTube after they’ve typed specific keywords on Google! ADM strongly recommends implementing this strategy. We will apply best practices for this custom intent audience, identifying keyword themes to deliver to specific audience segments.

Does this seem a bit complicated? That’s what we are here for! Let ADM handle your bidding, keyword planning and handle the measurement by providing solid reporting. As a Google Partner, that’s our role. Helping to drive big results by using the right tactics. 

Speaker Ryan Knowles, Global Product Lead, Performance Video shared about driving attention in a low-attention mobile world. We know our drop in attention span has led to more competition than ever before.

 

Stats to Note:

80% of users multitask on another device while watching TV.

7 in 10 teens watch 3+ hours of mobile video per day and 2x more YouTube + Netflix than cable.

With society cutting the cord, the solution is clear where your video needs to live. YouTube ads are a full sight and sound pitch for your business to a viewer who’s leaning in to watch. 95% of YouTube ads play in-view and with the sound on! Obviously the more attention your brand receives on this platform, the more efficient results you will see.

With location extensions for TrueView ads, you can drive clicks right from a video to do actions like Get Directions, Read Reviews, Call the Business, See Store Hours and more.

 

Did you know you could track online to offline conversions/visits to your location? You can do this with store visits tracking. It tells us how many people viewed your YouTube ad visited your location.

 

As always, we are here to answer your questions. As Google Partners, we can help you take advantage of YouTube, taking the viewer from attention to action.

Ready to use these tactics in your digital video campaigns? Click the button below for a free consultation from one of our consultants.

objects.html_title: Geo-Fencing Explained!
objects.label: Geo-Fencing Explained!

meta.post_summary: Location Based Advertising
meta.html_title: Geo-Fencing Explained!
meta.meta_description: Geo-fencing is explained in the latest blog from Affect Digital Media.
meta.post_body:
Location Based Advertising

You are probably familiar with Geo-targeted digital advertising. Basic Geo-targeting delivers digital advertising to consumers in specific locations. Generally these are campaigns and ad units targeted to people living in certain cities or neighborhoods. Perhaps a certain zip code. Geo-Fencing takes this concept a step further.

 

Geo-Fencing Made Simple

Modern smartphones collect and distribute data about us constantly. One of the most valuable pieces of data to marketers is the exact location of a given target customer. Location can indicate interest more than other types of data. Modern smartphones provide extremely accurate GPS functions. In-turn, this data becomes available to marketers like us in real time.

For instance, if your store sells mattresses it would make sense to target consumers that are visiting or have visited stores that also sell mattresses. Geo-Fencing makes this possible and can help local businesses win more customers.

 

Components Of A Successful Geo-Fencing Campaign

  • The Targeting Zone: This is the location you want to target. You want to deliver your advertising message to people that are either currently visiting or have recently visited this location. The Target Zone can be a specific address or multiple addresses.
  • The Message: This is your offer or the advertising unit you want to deliver to people in the target zone.
  • The Conversion Zone: This is the where you measure the effectiveness of this campaign. When a person that has been in the target zone is delivered your message and then visits your store this is a conversion. Like the Target Zone, the Conversion Zone can be an exact address, multiple addresses or any location specified on a map.

 

Pitfalls Of Geo-Fencing Campaigns

  • Relying On Singular Tactics: Geo-Fencing is an excellent tactic to incorporate into an overall campaign strategy. However, Geo-Fencing shouldn’t be the only tactic employed. Search retargeting, site retargeting, a strong social media strategy and other tactics should be included in any successful campaign.
  • Poor Technology Partners: Geo-Fencing is a hot topic right now. However, many providers haven’t invested in high quality technology platforms that allow truly address specific targeting.
  • Poor Creative Messaging: Your creative is also important. Consumers have short attention spans and you’re competing with multiple advertising messages. Your creative must be on point and relevant.

 

Ready to use this tactic in your digital advertising approach? Click the button below for a free consultation from one of our consultants.

 

{{cta('15d68cad-f4e2-450f-8dcf-9a7f235d59d6')}}

objects.html_title: ADM Wins Best Digital Agency Two Years in a Row
objects.label: ADM Wins Best Digital Agency Two Years in a Row

meta.post_body:
Seventy different companies competed in the Local Media Association’s annual Digital Innovation Contest and the results are in. Affect Digital Media took top honors as Best Digital Agency, this being the second year to receive the award, as well as first place in Best New Digital Initiative and second place for Best Native/Sponsored Content. The faculty at the Medill School/Northwestern University judged the categories.

“For two years in a row, ADM has proven to be a force to reckon with in the advertising agency world. We have proven to our valuable customers that our digital foresight and our complete, full service agency offerings are moving the needle and driving results. Our team shares this win with our customers,” said Jason Holmes, President and Co-Founder of Affect Digital Media. For Best Digital Agency, judges’ comments said, “an impressive array of products and competencies.”

“This is a highly competitive contest that recognizes the best of local media when it comes to digital innovation,” said Nancy Lane, President, Local Media Association.

 “ADM continues to break the mold in terms of product offerings and the high quality of service they provide to their customers, serving as true media consultants with the client’s best interests at the core of what they recommend. I couldn’t be more proud of this incredible team of specialists,” said Dan Easton, CEO and Co-Founder of Affect Digital Media.

For the Best Native/Sponsored Content Campaign, ADM entered their Brandsense native advertising campaign done for Jackson County Hospital District. Judges shared, “The synergy with the hospital’s brand and the outreach goal of the ad campaign is spot-on. Metrics are very encouraging as well. The campaign really underscores the importance of a health leader in a community.”

In the Best New Digital Initiative category, judges shared in reference to ADM’s entry of AgencyQue, a custom-developed project management software, “Affect Digital Media made a strong first impression on the judges by explaining the process through which they decided on building AgencyQue, a project management system: they saw the need from their customers and saw the lack of efficient product in the market. They had a very sustainable growth plan for the platform they built, actually finding a market for it.”

Ready to get started? Work with ADM today.

objects.name: ADM Wins Best Digital Agency Two Years in a Row
objects.page_title: ADM Wins Best Digital Agency Two Years in a Row

parent_blog.html_title: Digital Trends - Advocate Digital Media - Victoria, Texas
parent_blog.label: Digital Trends
parent_blog.name: Digital Trends

objects.post_body:
Seventy different companies competed in the Local Media Association’s annual Digital Innovation Contest and the results are in. Affect Digital Media took top honors as Best Digital Agency, this being the second year to receive the award, as well as first place in Best New Digital Initiative and second place for Best Native/Sponsored Content. The faculty at the Medill School/Northwestern University judged the categories.

“For two years in a row, ADM has proven to be a force to reckon with in the advertising agency world. We have proven to our valuable customers that our digital foresight and our complete, full service agency offerings are moving the needle and driving results. Our team shares this win with our customers,” said Jason Holmes, President and Co-Founder of Affect Digital Media. For Best Digital Agency, judges’ comments said, “an impressive array of products and competencies.”

“This is a highly competitive contest that recognizes the best of local media when it comes to digital innovation,” said Nancy Lane, President, Local Media Association.

 “ADM continues to break the mold in terms of product offerings and the high quality of service they provide to their customers, serving as true media consultants with the client’s best interests at the core of what they recommend. I couldn’t be more proud of this incredible team of specialists,” said Dan Easton, CEO and Co-Founder of Affect Digital Media.

For the Best Native/Sponsored Content Campaign, ADM entered their Brandsense native advertising campaign done for Jackson County Hospital District. Judges shared, “The synergy with the hospital’s brand and the outreach goal of the ad campaign is spot-on. Metrics are very encouraging as well. The campaign really underscores the importance of a health leader in a community.”

In the Best New Digital Initiative category, judges shared in reference to ADM’s entry of AgencyQue, a custom-developed project management software, “Affect Digital Media made a strong first impression on the judges by explaining the process through which they decided on building AgencyQue, a project management system: they saw the need from their customers and saw the lack of efficient product in the market. They had a very sustainable growth plan for the platform they built, actually finding a market for it.”

Ready to get started? Work with ADM today.

objects.html_title: ADM to Exhibit at Victoria Chamber Business Expo
objects.label: ADM to Exhibit at Victoria Chamber Business Expo

meta.post_body:
The Victoria Chamber of Commerce will host their 2018 Chamber Business Expo on Thursday, March 8 at the Victoria College Emerging Technology Complex. Attendees will have the chance to walk through different booths and meet with local businesses, its owners and learn what each has to offer. Over 30 loca exhibitors, including Affect Digital Media, will be on hand to provide information on their products and service. The event is free to the public and will take place from 4 p.m. to 7 p.m. A ribbon cutting for the event will be at 3:50 p.m.

“We at Affect Digital Media enjoy participating at these events because they give us a chance to visit one-on-one with our customers and offers a chance to meet our local team of digital experts,” said Jason Holmes, Co-Founder and President of Affect Digital Media.

Besides the great networking opportunity, attendees will also be able to sample craft IPA beer compliments of Del Papa Distributing and Two-Row Distributing in the Tasting Room. Affect Digital Media’s booth will have tasty snacks available compliments of Cimarron Express, as well as Google pens, notepads, water bottles and more, as ADM is the only Google partner in the area. One lucky attendee will get to take home a beautiful spring floral arrangement from McAdams Floral.

 “Take a few minutes to visit with the ADM team at our booth and let our knowledgeable staff answer your questions on digital advertising. We can also set a time for free consultation to discuss your plans for digital advertising in 2018,” said Holmes. 

Ready to get started today? Work with ADM today.

objects.author: jtholmes@advocatedigital.com
objects.html_title: Beware of the Bundle!
objects.label: Beware of the Bundle!

meta.post_summary:
It's that time of year. You can see them coming.

Traditional media reps with the latest wiz bang marketing technology or trend made popular by a silicon valley startup last year. The process is so predictable that you can set your watch by it. Fresh out of planning meetings and training programs designed to reverse their inevitable slide these poor folks are given the directive to "sell the Internet..."

 

Some Background

All traditional media - Newspapers, Local TV stations and Radio stations are under assault from digital competitors at every level.

Google, Facebook and the entire digital ecosystem have rendered these traditional media companies nearly irrelevant when it comes to reaching the valuable demographics embodied in Baby Boomers, Generation X and especially Millennials. The slide in audience has been horrific and irreversible.

This is a classic case of not understanding what business you're in. Newspapers, radio and TV stations have historically believed that they were in the business of selling "space" and "distribution." Unfortunately, this is similar to the mistake made by buggy whip manufacturers at the turn of the last century. Whip manufacturers were actually in the business of making the vehicle go faster not whipping horses. Likewise, media companies used to be in the business of improving the bottom line of their customers. That business model has slowely transformed into something more self serving.

 

What To Do?

As these bussiness lines have deteriorated and the audience has shifted to non centralized digital platforms disrupted media companies have increasingly started to play a game of "me too." 

Every year there is a new gimmick. Unfortunately, the products and services offered to local businesses by these organizations are generally poorly executed, ineffective and outsourced. The product lineup and business plan is designed to help the media company slow an inevitable revenue slide rather than help your business grow and truly reach new audiences.

All traditional media - Newspapers, Local TV stations and Radio stations are under assault from digital competitors at every level.

This is a classic case of not understanding what business you're in. Newspapers, radio and TV stations have historically believed that they were in the business of selling "space" and "distribution." Unfortunately, this is similar to the mistake made by buggy whip manufacturers at the turn of the last century. Whip manufacturers were actually in the business of making the vehicle go faster not whipping horses. Likewise, media companies used to be in the business of improving the bottom line of their customers. That business model has slowely transformed into something more self serving.

 

What To Do?

As these bussiness lines have deteriorated and the audience has shifted to non centralized digital platforms disrupted media companies have increasingly started to play a game of "me too." 

Every year there is a new gimmick. Unfortunately, the products and services offered to local businesses by these organizations are generally poorly executed, ineffective and outsourced. The product lineup and business plan is designed to help the media company slow an inevitable revenue slide rather than help your business grow and truly reach new audiences.

objects.author: jtholmes@advocatedigital.com
objects.html_title: Why Buy The Site? Own The Audience! (Clone)
objects.label: Why Buy The Site? Own The Audience! (Clone)

meta.post_body:
I recently noticed an interesting advertising sales sheet left behind by a local media account executive. It said "advertise on our award winning site" for just $949 per month. This piece was interesting for a number of reasons.

  • The prices didn't sound that competitive, pretty high for the audience size actually.
  • The packages only targeted people on one local website - a primitive approach in 2018.
  • Various sizes were bundled together, with no mention of targeting or mobile.

But this sales sheet was interesting for another reason as well. You see, I was the one that put the corresponding data together. Of course, this was way back in 2011. It was another time and back then a product like this made sense.

Smart marketers know that this single site appoach is ancient history and a waste of money from a modern marketing perspective. In 2011, the data we as marketers had access to was far more limited and not nearly as accurate. Smart phone use was in it's infancy.

 

Pew Research Center

 

In 2018, we know so much more about our audiences. Not just which sites they visit but when, why and what they have been recently shopping for. We know their individual demographic information, who they spend time with, what emails they open and read, their credit scores and can compare all of this data against, well, other reams of data.

With the rise of mobile, we can compare all of this data against consumer locations and when they access all of these resources. The marketer can compare consumers that see your messages with groups of consumers that physically come into your store, or the stores of your competitors.

Today's most effective marketing is always data-driven. Wouldn't it be much more efficient to get your message in front of proven buyers not just readers?

Don't buy the site. Own the audience!

Don't just buy the site. Own the right audience!
objects.post_body_rss:
I recently noticed an interesting advertising sales sheet left behind by a local media account executive. It said "advertise on our award winning site" for just $949 per month. This piece was interesting for a number of reasons.

  • The prices didn't sound that competitive, pretty high for the audience size actually.
  • The packages only targeted people on one local website - a primitive approach in 2018.
  • Various sizes were bundled together, with no mention of targeting or mobile.

But this sales sheet was interesting for another reason as well. You see, I was the one that put the corresponding data together. Of course, this was way back in 2011. It was another time and back then a product like this made sense.

Smart marketers know that this single site appoach is ancient history and a waste of money from a modern marketing perspective. In 2011, the data we as marketers had access to was far more limited and not nearly as accurate. Smart phone use was in it's infancy.

 

Pew Research Center

 

In 2018, we know so much more about our audiences. Not just which sites they visit but when, why and what they have been recently shopping for. We know their individual demographic information, who they spend time with, what emails they open and read, their credit scores and can compare all of this data against, well, other reams of data.

With the rise of mobile, we can compare all of this data against consumer locations and when they access all of these resources. The marketer can compare consumers that see your messages with groups of consumers that physically come into your store, or the stores of your competitors.

Today's most effective marketing is always data-driven. Wouldn't it be much more efficient to get your message in front of proven buyers not just readers?

Amazon uses this data like no other company on earth. But guess what: You can access audiences in the same way and leverage your web presence to drive in store traffic and sales. We help hundreds of local businesses do this every day and we can help you too.

Don't just buy the site. Own the right audience!

objects.html_title: Brands Rocked by Facebook Newsfeed Announcement. Here's Your Survival Guide.
objects.label: Brands Rocked by Facebook Newsfeed Announcement. Here's Your Survival Guide.

meta.post_body:
Once again, Facebook will be making another very large, important update in the coming months. Mark Zuckerburg recently announced that they will be cleaning up the newsfeed to include more content from friends and family as well as important news and updates that spark conversation. This means that they will be limiting public content, including videos, from publishers and business pages.

 

So what does this mean for marketers?

Basically, if you have a following of 5,000, you generally reach maybe 100 - 300 on average organically, give or take. We all know it’s a small percentage, between 3% - 6%. With this new change, organic reach may drop to half of that! They also stated that during the update, reach and traffic will decrease varying from page to page. This will be impacted by type of content and how people interact with it.

 

No more clickbait

Pages that post "clickbait articles" and "engagement-bait” posts will be highly affected. For example, the grid of pictures asking you to select a reaction or a contest asking you to like, share and comment to win. Pages that use these types of “baiting” will see negative impacts on their reach and page and may even see drops after they have stopped. Facebook views these as meaningless engagement interactions.

 

 

Quality over Quantity 

What they say they really want to see is meaningful interactions so quality over quantity will be key. So much so that if you don’t have good content, it would actually be better not to post. Especially since pages that over-post will also be dinged by Facebook. Posting 30 times a day will not help reach people in the newsfeed, it will only hurt your page.

 

What about Instagram?

Since Instagram is a part of Facebook and has followed suit with algorithm changes in the past, this change will most likely happen there in the future as well so be prepared.

 

What Facebook Likes Most: Profits

Most importantly, Facebook will be even more of a pay-to-play environment. Organic is what’s going to be affected by this change not advertising.

 

 

 

So what can my business do?

 

  1. Set Social Goals.

Make sure you know what you are trying accomplish on Facebook, especially now that campaigns are going to be even more important. Having monthly or quarterly goals will help to plan out your campaigns and post strategies making them more effective.

 

  1. Get Personal with Content.

For local businesses, Facebook encourages you to connect with the community as a whole so relevance and authenticity will be very important. Stop using stock photos and get more personal with creative. Live videos will be another great component.

 

  1. Incorporate Local Stars.

Influencers are about to become an even more important part of social media. This will definitely be something to consider adding into your budget in 2018. Don’t think too big either; consider local celebrities or even loyal customers.

 

  1. You Gotta Pay to Play.

And if you weren’t putting any budget into Facebook, now is the time to start. Organic reach is dying. You will need dollars to reach the right people and now more that ever, it’s important to have someone managing your Facebook who knows what they are doing.

 

Change is Coming. Get Ready!

Keep in mind the update hasn’t happened yet (it was just announced) so there is no way to know exactly how much of an impact it’s going to have on your page just yet so there’s no need to panic. Now is the time to prepare and adjust your post strategy.

 

Not sure where to start? Let ADM help you with your social media planning, creating local, engaging content that garners real results for your business. The ever-changing digital world, especially social media, is not slowing down. Work with a digital partnerthat stays on top of these changes every single day and can fulfill your campaign locally! Work with ADM today.

What they say they really want to see is meaningful interactions so quality over quantity will be key. So much so that if you don’t have good content, it would actually be better not to post. Especially since pages that over-post will also be dinged by Facebook. Posting 30 times a day will not help reach people in the newsfeed, it will only hurt your page.

 

What about Instagram?

Since Instagram is a part of Facebook and has followed suit with algorithm changes in the past, this change will most likely happen there in the future as well so be prepared.

 

What Facebook Likes Most: Profits

Most importantly, Facebook will be even more of a pay-to-play environment. Organic is what’s going to be affected by this change not advertising.

 

 

 

So what can my business do?

 

  1. Set Social Goals.

Make sure you know what you are trying accomplish on Facebook, especially now that campaigns are going to be even more important. Having monthly or quarterly goals will help to plan out your campaigns and post strategies making them more effective.

 

  1. Get Personal with Content.

For local businesses, Facebook encourages you to connect with the community as a whole so relevance and authenticity will be very important. Stop using stock photos and get more personal with creative. Live videos will be another great component.

 

  1. Incorporate Local Stars.

Influencers are about to become an even more important part of social media. This will definitely be something to consider adding into your budget in 2018. Don’t think too big either; consider local celebrities or even loyal customers.

 

  1. You Gotta Pay to Play.

And if you weren’t putting any budget into Facebook, now is the time to start. Organic reach is dying. You will need dollars to reach the right people and now more that ever, it’s important to have someone managing your Facebook who knows what they are doing.

 

Change is Coming. Get Ready!

Keep in mind the update hasn’t happened yet (it was just announced) so there is no way to know exactly how much of an impact it’s going to have on your page just yet so there’s no need to panic. Now is the time to prepare and adjust your post strategy.

 

Not sure where to start? Let ADM help you with your social media planning, creating local, engaging content that garners real results for your business. The ever-changing digital world, especially social media, is not slowing down. Work with a digital partnerthat stays on top of these changes every single day and can fulfill your campaign locally! Work with ADM today.
body.value:
Once again, Facebook will be making another very large, important update in the coming months. Mark Zuckerburg recently announced that they will be cleaning up the newsfeed to include more content from friends and family as well as important news and updates that spark conversation. This means that they will be limiting public content, including videos, from publishers and business pages.

 

So what does this mean for marketers?

Basically, if you have a following of 5,000, you generally reach maybe 100 - 300 on average organically, give or take. We all know it’s a small percentage, between 3% - 6%. With this new change, organic reach may drop to half of that! They also stated that during the update, reach and traffic will decrease varying from page to page. This will be impacted by type of content and how people interact with it.

 

No more clickbait

Pages that post "clickbait articles" and "engagement-bait” posts will be highly affected. For example, the grid of pictures asking you to select a reaction or a contest asking you to like, share and comment to win. Pages that use these types of “baiting” will see negative impacts on their reach and page and may even see drops after they have stopped. Facebook views these as meaningless engagement interactions.

 

 

Quality over Quantity 

What they say they really want to see is meaningful interactions so quality over quantity will be key. So much so that if you don’t have good content, it would actually be better not to post. Especially since pages that over-post will also be dinged by Facebook. Posting 30 times a day will not help reach people in the newsfeed, it will only hurt your page.

objects.html_title: 5 Steps For Winning in 2018
objects.label: 5 Steps For Winning in 2018

meta.post_body:
The New Year is upon us and another Q4 is in the rearview mirror. While there is generally a lull in shopping activity, consumer spending will begin to heat up in just a few short weeks. People tend to buy living room furniture, particularly recliners leading up to the Super Bowl and shortly after the big game Valentines Day gift giving will be in full swing. As a marketer, there isn’t much time off!

Now is a good time to tweak your approach and improve your local digital marketing plan. Following these 5 simple steps will have you well on your way:

 

Step 1: Evaluate Your Business Presence

This means your website, social network profiles, and business directory listings. Is the basic information accurate? Business hours, addresses, website links, specials, etc. With this region growing so fast there are literally thousands of people new to the area. The Internet is the number one source for information when relocating.

Repeat step one on a mobile device. This can be eye opening. If you consider that more than 60% of search engine traffic is now mobile and that more than 50% of that traffic has local intent – local people are searching for local businesses, products, and services. Are you ready to delight these potential customers?

 

Step 2: Evaluate Your Competition

Evaluate your competition from the viewpoint of a consumer online. If you’re competing with national companies or large regional players it may seem daunting to take that fight online. What are your advantages over big box stores.? You likely highlight these advantages to your customer base everyday in your store or in your marketing message. Are you getting that message out through digital means?

 

Step 3: Educate

Educate yourself. Find local digital marketing experts and ask them tough questions. If they’re asking you to spend money with them then there are no dumb questions in the realm of digital advertising. Ask questions until you have a working understanding of what you’re buying.

 

Step 4: Implement

Develop your strategy. Who is your target market? What tactics may work best to reach them? Work with your trusted expert to develop and implement your campaign.

 

Step 5: Optimize

Make sure you understand your reporting and then optimize your campaigns accordingly. Are your paid search campaigns and targeted display campaigns converting well? Are you getting buyers to your website across desktop, tablets, and smartphones?

Of course, this isn’t an exhaustive list. However, by following these simple steps and learning along the way you’ll be well ahead of other local businesses!

objects.html_title: Think you can't afford an agency? Think again!
objects.label: Think you can't afford an agency? Think again!

meta.post_body:
You probably already know that ADM was named the 2017 Agency of the Year by the Local Media Association! 

But many local businesses think they can't afford an agency, especially one of our caliber. But did you know our customers generally SAVE money when we get involved? How does that happen? Well look at everything you get:

  • Professional Negotiation: We negotiate with all local media on your behalf. This means you save time and can run your business while we get you the best. 

  • Award Winning Creative: Your message is only as good as it's creative and our designers will provide your business with creatvie elements you can be proud of!  Doesn't your busines deserve creative that competes well with larger competitors?

  • Budget Planning: So many local businesses have no idea what they're spending on advertising or whom they're spending it with. Isn't it time to professionalize this part of your business?

  • Results Focused Advice: Since we represent so many local businesses we get to see what works and what doesn't. Should you continue to invest in newspaper advertising? What about Yellow Pages? We can help you answer these questions.

Contact us today for your free, no pressure consultation!

objects.html_title: 6 tips for Choosing A Digital Agency
objects.label: 6 tips for Choosing A Digital Agency

meta.post_body:
Even here in South Texas media consumption and consumer habits have shifted. Over the past two decades, digital channels have grown from little known websites and networks to the new mass media. Print media, broadcast television, terrestrial radio, and relative newcomer cable television have given ground and market share to what used to be called “new media". Digital media is now mainstream media. In the future, it appears all media will eventually be digital. The trend doesn’t lie.

We know from our interaction with local businesses and data sources like Borrell Associates that national and local businesses have made digital media far and away the biggest chunk of their marketing and promotions budgets. Digital advertising is projected to comprise more than 40% of all advertising spend within our market this year – ballooning to nearly 55% over the next few years.

As a business owner that’s responsible for marketing your goods and services, you owe it to yourself, your employees, and even your customers to align your business’ marketing strategy with this digital reality. This is especially true when entrusting a partner like an advertising agency to execute your marketing strategy.

As we prepare for 2018, I’d encourage you to evaluate and reevaluate your advertising agency relationship. Digital marketing isn’t a fad or something that should be an afterthought in your overall marketing strategy. It's an important part of your brand strategy and any possible partner should be vetted. How do you verify a contender’s credentials?

  1. Ask for Case Studies: What customers have they helped? What was the strategy? How were these tactics employed? We can do digital too is not a strategy.
  2. Ask For A List Of Competitors: That's right! Ask them who they compete with in the marketplace and why they are better. Any agency worth their salt will confidently provide you with a list of local competitors and gladly talk about their unique strengths.
  3. Are They Local Or Outsourced? Does your point of contact have regular conversations, preferably face to face, with the team that actually fulfills your campaigns? This is a key differentiator and our customers love knowing they can get in a room with local designers, developers, and certified fulfillment experts.
  4. What are their credentials? Are they Google certified directly or do they rely on a partner? Can they directly converse with Facebook and Google about the performance of your campaigns or do they need to call their "Digital Agency In A Box" partner? This is a favorite strategy of traditional media companies.
  5. What Do They Talk About? Do they talk about products or solutions? This is a huge differentiator. A quality agency will walk with you through your journey toward finding new customers.
  6. Do They Practice What They Preach? Finally, make sure your new digital agency has a great website, is active on social media, and ranks well for the products and services you're employing to reach your goals.

If you go to their website and it says "Hello World!" or "Coming Soon" it's time to LOL and move on!

We hope these tips are helpful! If you would be interested in discussing your digital presence and how Affect Digital Media can help please contact us below!

objects.html_title: ADM Rebrand FAQ
objects.label: ADM Rebrand FAQ

meta.post_body:
Why the name change?

The name Advocate Digital Media has served us well over the years. However, as ADM has continued to grow in South and East Texas; in other markets; and with clients around the country, it made sense for us to rebrand now and prepare for future growth.

 

What is really changing?

Nothing is changing for our customers! Your trusted ADM account executives are ready and able to continue helping you market and grow your business. Our team of dedicated digital marketers and certified experts are continuing their award winning work on your behalf! Meet the team!

 

Are you no longer affiliated with The Victoria Advocate?

The Victoria Advocate and other M. Roberts Media properties are now customers of Affect Digital Media. During this transition period, ADM will continue to support these properties.

 

What sets your products and services from the rest?

Affect Digital Media only provides premium products and services that are executed with your goals in mind. Many media companies try to offer cookie cutter solutions and “one size fits all” packages. That isn’t strategy and certainly won’t help you grow your business. Our process is very different!

 

What is next?

Great things are ahead! We have a number of new products and services that are rolling out now and great things are coming in 2018 for our customers! Online invoicing and bill pay, better reporting, and enhanced campaign integration are improvements our customers can look forward to!

 

What products and services do you offer?

If you’re not familiar with ADM, this is a great question! We offer everything from strategic services like media planning and budgeting to the tactics that ensure these strategies are successful and get the results you expect! We can handle as much or as little of your marketing efforts as you need!

 

Who is Affect Digital Media?

We are a dedicated team of marketing experts that concentrate on digital. ADM won the 2017 Local Media Association’s Digital Agency Of The Year and numerous national and regional awards over the past several years. Our team is made up of thought leaders, account executives, designers, developers, social media experts and Google certified fulfillment experts. We demand passion and expertise from our team and it shows in their work!

 

Who are your clients? What business types do you work with?

Chances are good that you know our clients. We work with some of the most successful brands in the market. You can check out our portfolio page for a taste of what we do. We work with huge companies like regional banks with hundreds of locations as well as very small businesses like single location bakeries and other “mom and pop” shops. ADM can help you compete with giant retail and online stores regardless of the size of your business.

 

Have more questions?

ADM can help you compete with giant retail and online stores regardless of the size of your business.

 

Have more questions?
objects.post_email_content:
Why the name change?

The name Advocate Digital Media has served us well over the years. However, as ADM has continued to grow in South and East Texas; in other markets; and with clients around the country, it made sense for us to rebrand now and prepare for future growth.
