objects.rss_body:
Why the name change?

The name Advocate Digital Media has served us well over the years. However, as ADM has continued to grow in South and East Texas; in other markets; and with clients around the country, it made sense for us to rebrand now and prepare for future growth.

 

What is really changing?

Nothing is changing for our customers! Your trusted ADM account executives are ready and able to continue helping you market and grow your business. Our team of dedicated digital marketers and certified experts are continuing their award winning work on your behalf! Meet the team!

 

Are you no longer affiliated with The Victoria Advocate?

The Victoria Advocate and other M. Roberts Media properties are now customers of Affect Digital Media. During this transition period, ADM will continue to support these properties.

 

What sets your products and services from the rest?

Affect Digital Media only provides premium products and services that are executed with your goals in mind. Many media companies try to offer cookie cutter solutions and “one size fits all” packages. That isn’t strategy and certainly won’t help you grow your business. Our process is very different!

 

What is next?

Great things are ahead! We have a number of new products and services that are rolling out now and great things are coming in 2018 for our customers! Online invoicing and bill pay, better reporting, and enhanced campaign integration are improvements our customers can look forward to!

 

What products and services do you offer?

If you’re not familiar with ADM, this is a great question! We offer everything from strategic services like media planning and budgeting to the tactics that ensure these strategies are successful and get the results you expect! We can handle as much or as little of your marketing efforts as you need!

 

Who is Affect Digital Media?

We are a dedicated team of marketing experts that concentrate on digital. ADM won the 2017 Local Media Association’s Digital Agency Of The Year and numerous national and regional awards over the past several years. Our team is made up of thought leaders, account executives, designers, developers, social media experts and Google certified fulfillment experts. We demand passion and expertise from our team and it shows in their work!

 

Who are your clients? What business types do you work with?

Chances are good that you know our clients. We work with some of the most successful brands in the market. You can check out our portfolio page for a taste of what we do. We work with huge companies like regional banks with hundreds of locations as well as very small businesses like single location bakeries and other “mom and pop” shops. ADM can help you compete with giant retail and online stores regardless of the size of your business.

 

Have more questions?

objects.author: emily@advocatedigital.com
objects.html_title: ADM Unveils New Name - Affect Digital Media
objects.label: ADM Unveils New Name - Affect Digital Media

meta.post_body:
Advocate Digital Media, a Texas-based digital advertising firm, has rebranded as “Affect Digital Media” and will primarily go by “ADM” moving forward.

 

“Over the past few years, digital media placement has gone from an afterthought to the most important component of any successful marketing strategy," said ADM Co-Founder and President Jason Holmes. "Our intense focus on customer success ensures that we concentrate on what works for our clients rather than what may be convenient. Customers can continue to count on our skilled local team and our established, best-of-breed products and services.  To focus completely on that mission, and assure our customers we are completely media agnostic, it was essential to separate our company from the shadow of traditional media and rebrand our full-service agency.”

 

“I couldn’t be more excited about the future direction of our company,” said Dan Easton, CEO and Co-Founder of ADM.  “Formed as a business unit supporting the digital operations of traditional media, this move to spin-off ADM allows us to focus efforts exclusively on the most rapidly growing part of our business: our digital marketing and full-service agency clients. Our mission is to help businesses grow by maximizing the return on their marketing and advertising investment.”

 

“When you work with the ADM team, you work with local experts that not only provide modern solutions like fully-integrated marketing campaigns, websites, social media, digital advertising, video and more, but we also fulfill all of these right here in Texas. From design to media placement, our solutions are custom-crafted for each client with their best interests at the core of what we do,” said Easton.

 

To learn more about Affect Digital Media, visit AffectDigital.com

 

With offices in Victoria, Corpus Christi and Longview, TX, Affect Digital Media is a full service digital advertising agency and Google Partner serving hundreds of customers across the country. Offering targeted digital campaigns, fully-integrated marketing campaigns, responsive website design and optimization, industry leading search engine strategies and social media plans for a variety of clients. The agency handles all forms of advertising and marketing, including branding, creative design, video production, outdoor, online, TV, radio, and print, as well as media planning, budgeting and buying. Learn more at www.AffectDigital.com

objects.html_title: ADM Presents Modern Marketing Bootcamp on Oct. 12
objects.label: ADM Presents Modern Marketing Bootcamp on Oct. 12

meta.post_body:
Advocate Digital Media Presents Modern Marketing Bootcamp

 

Advocate Digital Media will present a Modern Marketing bootcamp for area business leaders on Thursday, Oct. 12 at the Victoria College Emerging Technology Complex. The event will include real world takeaways to help business leaders execute their marketing strategy effectives for the fourth quarter, as well as 2018.

 

 

The event, happening from 8:30 a.m. – 3 p.m., includes a robust list of speakers, include many local Advocate Digital Media staff, as well as lunch keynote speaker Corey Elliott, VP of Research with Borrell Associates Inc. Topics covered by the ADM team include social media, native advertising, email trends, latest in video and looking beyond analytics to see how your digital advertising is truly performing.

 

Keynote speaker Corey Elliott heads up all of Borrell’s various research projects and products, including Compass market data. Prior to Borrell, he was director of market intelligence at Gannett Co. Inc., where he worked across the company’s media properties to grow advertising revenue by providing research and data support. Elliot has more than 15 years of experience in strategy and research.  

 

 

Breakfast and lunch will be provided and registration is required to attend. Registration fee is $49. Learn more and register at www.advocatedigital.com/MMB

 

“I'm thrilled to see Advocate Digital Media bring these events to the Crossroads to educate our business leaders,” said Dan Easton, CEO and co-founder of ADM. “They do terrific work for their clients, who they see as partners, and educating them on the latest in digital advertising is a key part of that relationship.”

meta.html_title: ADM Presents Modern Marketing Bootcamp on Oct. 12

meta.rss_body:
Advocate Digital Media Presents Lone Star Recruiter Tool

 Advocate Digital Media has launched a turnkey recruitment solution – Lone Star Recruiter - for hiring managers. Those responsible for hiring are invited to attend an educational event to learn more about Lone Star Recruiter on Tuesday, Oct. 10 from 4 – 6 p.m. at Advocate Digital Media’s office located at 4611 E. Airline, Suite 200 in Victoria.

 

 

“We listened to our clients. One of the biggest challenges to running a successful business today is recruiting and retaining talent. To respond to this challenge, we launched Lone Star Recruiter, a complete digital recruitment solution. Rather than having to post to each individual job platform, hiring managers can now automatically distribute their openings across all major job networks, as well as Facebook and other popular social platforms,” said Jason Holmes, ADM Co-Founder and President.

 

With Lone Star Recruiter, one posting reaches your audience across major social networks, including Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Google+ and more. The quality matching program searches millions of resumes and sends email alerts to candidates you seek, plus it is delivered across popular job search engines like Monster, ZipRecruiter and Career Builder.

 

At the Lone Star Recruiter event, attendees can come and go during the 4- 6 p.m. timeframe, enjoy refreshments, network with fellow HR leaders and learn more on the product.

 

To register to attend the event on October 10, visit www.advocatedigital.com/LSR

Rather than having to post to each individual job platform, hiring managers can now automatically distribute their openings across all major job networks, as well as Facebook and other popular social platforms,” said Jason Holmes, ADM Co-Founder and President.

 

With Lone Star Recruiter, one posting reaches your audience across major social networks, including Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Google+ and more. The quality matching program searches millions of resumes and sends email alerts to candidates you seek, plus it is delivered across popular job search engines like Monster, ZipRecruiter and Career Builder.

 

At the Lone Star Recruiter event, attendees can come and go during the 4- 6 p.m. timeframe, enjoy refreshments, network with fellow HR leaders and learn more on the product.

 

To register to attend the event on October 10, visit www.advocatedigital.com/LSR

objects.html_title: The Power of Using Google to Market Your Business
objects.label: The Power of Using Google to Market Your Business

meta.post_body:
The Power of Using Google to Market Your Business

On June 14th, the Longview Chamber of Commerce and Advocate Digital Media hosted a workshop for small businesses looking for a digital advantage over their competitors. Over 30 business professionals attended and we don’t think it was just for the free lunch (although a pepperoni Pizza King would be reason enough!)

What these professionals were hoping to get from this lunch & learn were tips on how to market their business in this digital age; specifically, how to harness the power of the 800-pound gorilla that is Google. Here is a synopsis of what we learned during the live-streamed webinar from Mountain View, California:

Buyers are No Longer Delaying Purchases

The days of walking aimlessly from store-to-store in the local shopping center are over. How many times have you yourself researched a product or service online before handing over your hard-earned cash to someone behind a counter? It happens with most purchases these days. Google provided some very interesting stats that opened more that a few eyes in the darkened room on Wednesday.

  • 84% of “near me” searches on Google happen on a smartphone. That means that people are looking for stores nearby while they are out-and-about.
  • 3 out of every 4 local searches from a mobile device will result in visit to a local store within 24 hours.
  • One-quarter of those visits will result in a purchase.
  • Even though ecommerce is very popular with shoppers, 85% of all transactions still happen at the local retailer.

There has been a 53% decrease in store foot traffic over the past several years. However, the value of each store visit has doubled because shoppers have done their homework before visiting the store! Given these facts, it is imperative that businesses engage with these smartphone users. If your website, SEO, and/or Google listing aren’t optimized for mobile searches, you are losing the sale.

One Minute and Ten Seconds

Another interesting stat from the workshop is that the typical mobile session happens within one minute and ten seconds. That means that a business website must be able to get a visitor from the moment they visit the web to complete a transaction, be it an online shopping cart or filling out a form for lead generation, in about the amount of time it takes to microwave a burrito. Speed is the new SEO!

How Smart Businesses Compete

People are checking their smartphones 150 times per day, therefore you must stand out when these people are comparing your business with your competitors online. Here’s how to do just that:

  1. Have a compelling website. Make sure that it is updated to work on all screens. A “responsive designed” site will allow people on their mobile devices to be able to utilize your website just as easily as those dinosaurs on their desktop computers.
  2. Create a free business listing on Google. It will often be the first thing that comes up in a Google search when people search for your business. With a validated free business listing, the business owner gets full control over the information, such as address, phone, website link, hours of operation, photos, responding to reviews, and more.
  3. Get free organic results on a Google search by making sure that your site has undergone “Search Engine Optimization” or SEO. Make use of important keywords on your site that people would use when searching for your product or service. Don’t forget to include your location, since many people use the term “near me” in their mobile searches.
  4. Make use of Google AdWords to show up in a paid placement at the top of search results. Bidding on keywords that you and your competitors use will give your business an advantage. Use keywords that define a “micro-moment” - a few words that someone would use when trying to solve an immediate problem or need. As an added bonus, AdWords is “Pay Per Click” marketing so you only pay for the advertising when someone clicks on the ad.
  5. Find a Google Partner. There are several local Google Partners in each community who work closely with Google in helping SMBs in their cities. Don’t be overwhelmed by all there is to know. Take advantage of the knowledge and experience of a valid Google Partner.

As a Google Partner, we at Advocate Digital Media are here to help local small and medium-sized businesses with their marketing. ADM plans to have more of these Google workshops in the future and we would be very interested in seeing even more businesses participate.

objects.html_title: Advocate Digital Media Wins National Native Advertising Award
objects.label: Advocate Digital Media Wins National Native Advertising Award

meta.post_summary: Advocate Digital Media recently won the Best Native Advertising/Sponsored Content Campaign award in the Local Media Association's Digital Innovation Contest. ADM received this award for their work on DeTar Healthcare System’s integrated 2016 native advertising campaign, which ran on VictoriaAdvocate.com as well as on targeted display ads across the web. Entries were submitted by agencies, newspapers, broadcast companies and digital news sites from throughout the United States.
meta.html_title: Advocate Digital Media Wins National Native Advertising Award
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Advocate Digital Media recently won the Best Native Advertising/Sponsored Content Campaign award in the Local Media Association's Digital Innovation Contest. ADM received this award for their work on DeTar Healthcare System’s integrated 2016 native advertising campaign, which ran on VictoriaAdvocate.com as well as on targeted display ads across the web. Entries were submitted by agencies, newspapers, broadcast companies and digital news sites from throughout the United States.

For this particular award category, Advocate Digital Media submitted several examples of content development work done for DeTar Healthcare System utilizing ADM’s custom content platform, BrandSense. BrandSense is an article-driven strategy for local businesses to share informative, relevant articles to educate the public and is heavily promoted both on the local site VictoriaAdvocate.com as well as across relevant websites across the Internet through targeted display advertising.

"This is a highly competitive contest that recognizes the best of local media when it comes to digital innovation," said Nancy Lane, President of the Local Media Association. The winners will deliver presentations at the LMA Digital Revenue Summit in May in Chicago.

“DeTar is thrilled to align our digital content strategy with ADM and to see the incredible results we have from the BrandSense campaigns. Through this innovative program, we’ve broken new grounds in the area of content marketing, helping to educate the Crossroads on relevant healthcare topics. We are pleased to see both our efforts as well as Advocate Digital Media’s native advertising strategy, rewarded through this national digital media contest,” said William Blanchard, CEO.     

“ADM being recognized for the industry-leading work being done right here in Victoria, Texas is an incredible honor,” said Jason Holmes, general manager of Advocate Digital Media. “Receiving this national award for Best Native Advertising from such a well respected national organization like Local Media Association speaks volumes about ADM’s inventive native advertising done for DeTar Healthcare System.”

In regards to the recent award, Dan Easton, publisher for the Victoria Advocate, offered his praise.

“I'm thrilled to see ADM get recognized by these awards,” said Easton. “They do terrific work for their clients, who they see as partners. This is also a testament to some of those partners, including DeTar Healthcare System, who make the investment in these types of campaigns.  Without their commitment, we wouldn't be able to innovate.”

The Local Media Association serves more than 2,400 local media companies in the industry including newspapers, TV, radio, directories and pure plays as well as several hundred research and development partners with the digital transition via programs, conferences, webinars, research and training.

Interested in learning more? Please call Advocate Digital Media or complete the contact us form on our site for a free digital marketing consultation. We’d love to learn more about your business and share how our services can help you grow your bottom line!
Visit www.advocatedigital.com or call 1-855-322-3355.

And, check out our recent case study on Pandora, the streaming music titan. We want you to be in the know on the latest digital offerings and advertising options!

objects.name: Advocate Digital Media Wins National Native Advertising Award
objects.page_title: Advocate Digital Media Wins National Native Advertising Award

parent_blog.html_title: Digital Trends - Advocate Digital Media - Victoria, Texas
parent_blog.label: Digital Trends
parent_blog.name: Digital Trends

objects.post_body:
Advocate Digital Media recently won the Best Native Advertising/Sponsored Content Campaign award in the Local Media Association's Digital Innovation Contest. ADM received this award for their work on DeTar Healthcare System’s integrated 2016 native advertising campaign, which ran on VictoriaAdvocate.com as well as on targeted display ads across the web. Entries were submitted by agencies, newspapers, broadcast companies and digital news sites from throughout the United States.

For this particular award category, Advocate Digital Media submitted several examples of content development work done for DeTar Healthcare System utilizing ADM’s custom content platform, BrandSense. BrandSense is an article-driven strategy for local businesses to share informative, relevant articles to educate the public and is heavily promoted both on the local site VictoriaAdvocate.com as well as across relevant websites across the Internet through targeted display advertising.

"This is a highly competitive contest that recognizes the best of local media when it comes to digital innovation," said Nancy Lane, President of the Local Media Association. The winners will deliver presentations at the LMA Digital Revenue Summit in May in Chicago.

“DeTar is thrilled to align our digital content strategy with ADM and to see the incredible results we have from the BrandSense campaigns. Through this innovative program, we’ve broken new grounds in the area of content marketing, helping to educate the Crossroads on relevant healthcare topics. We are pleased to see both our efforts as well as Advocate Digital Media’s native advertising strategy, rewarded through this national digital media contest,” said William Blanchard, CEO.     

“ADM being recognized for the industry-leading work being done right here in Victoria, Texas is an incredible honor,” said Jason Holmes, general manager of Advocate Digital Media. “Receiving this national award for Best Native Advertising from such a well respected national organization like Local Media Association speaks volumes about ADM’s inventive native advertising done for DeTar Healthcare System.”

In regards to the recent award, Dan Easton, publisher for the Victoria Advocate, offered his praise.

“I'm thrilled to see ADM get recognized by these awards,” said Easton. “They do terrific work for their clients, who they see as partners. This is also a testament to some of those partners, including DeTar Healthcare System, who make the investment in these types of campaigns.  Without their commitment, we wouldn't be able to innovate.”

The Local Media Association serves more than 2,400 local media companies in the industry including newspapers, TV, radio, directories and pure plays as well as several hundred research and development partners with the digital transition via programs, conferences, webinars, research and training.

Interested in learning more? Please call Advocate Digital Media or complete the contact us form on our site for a free digital marketing consultation. We’d love to learn more about your business and share how our services can help you grow your bottom line!
Visit www.advocatedigital.com or call 1-855-322-3355.

And, check out our recent case study on Pandora, the streaming music titan. We want you to be in the know on the latest digital offerings and advertising options!

objects.html_title: Do You Know Where Your Money Is Going
objects.label: Do You Know Where Your Money Is Going

meta.post_summary: It’s never a fun reality shock when you’re organizing your household budget and analyzing your monthly bank statements, and the total amount spent in the “restaurants” category strikes you in the face. The small purchases that you didn’t think would affect your bank ticker ended up eating a massive portion of your monthly and yearly income. According to a 2011 www.economywatch.com article, 57% of American households do not have a budget. Over half of us have no spending plan in place and the lack of a financial plan will undoubtedly invite spontaneous, and often reckless, spending. This all too pervasive habit not only means less money but it also prevents you from making smart, beneficial decisions with your money.
meta.html_title: Do You Know Where Your Money Is Going
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
It’s never a fun reality shock when you’re organizing your household budget and analyzing your monthly bank statements, and the total amount spent in the “restaurants” category strikes you in the face. The small purchases that you didn’t think would affect your bank ticker ended up eating a massive portion of your monthly and yearly income. According to a 2011 www.economywatch.com article, 57% of American households do not have a budget. Over half of us have no spending plan in place and the lack of a financial plan will undoubtedly invite spontaneous, and often reckless, spending. This all too pervasive habit not only means less money but it also prevents you from making smart, beneficial decisions with your money.
For businesses, this same bad habit parallels with the spontaneous, and sometimes reckless, purchasing of advertising or marketing packages either because the offer seemed enticing or because the decision-maker felt they were getting a “good deal”; and when it comes time for the seasonal sponsorships and fundraisers to start knocking on the doors, even more money leaves the business coffers. Then, when it comes time to analyze the quarterly or yearly budget, all of those “good deals” and booster club sponsorship donations add up to quite large expenses, which can often put the business is a frustrating financial situation.



Equally important is whether those “good deals” were even wise, beneficial expenditures. Not from the perspective of whether or not the price was right or affordable but did the expense work towards achieving a business goal. Did it drive traffic to your storefront? Did it generate revenue? Did it gain widespread brand awareness? Planning an advertising budget isn’t necessarily about estimating the cost of packages and trying to take advantage of good deals, instead the budget should accurately reflect a spending plan that is based on your business’s current goals and objectives. If your goal is to raise product awareness for a new line or promote the opening of a new location then your spending plan ought to reflect those goals. Will that catchy advertising package being pitched as a “good deal” effectively help you in achieving your goals? Merely having a plan in place will prepare you for smart spending. Even the expected seasonal sponsorships should be taken into consideration and worked into your budget. For instance, knowing that you are going to spend $100 total on sponsorships for the year is far more efficient than spontaneously spending $15 here and $25 there.

 

Without a plan, your money works against you, not for you. Take the opportunity to map out your business plan and plot out an advertising strategy that will help you achieve those goals. Set your budget and never have to worry about shocking bank statements ever again.

 

Interested in learning more? Please call Advocate Digital Media or complete the contact us form on our site for a free digital marketing consultation. We’d love to learn more about your business and how our services can help you grow your bottom line!
Visit www.advocatedigital.com or call 1-855-322-3355.
And, check out our recent case study on Pandora, the streaming music titan. We want you to be in the know on the latest digital offerings and advertising options!

Will that catchy advertising package being pitched as a “good deal” effectively help you in achieving your goals? Merely having a plan in place will prepare you for smart spending. Even the expected seasonal sponsorships should be taken into consideration and worked into your budget. For instance, knowing that you are going to spend $100 total on sponsorships for the year is far more efficient than spontaneously spending $15 here and $25 there.

 

Without a plan, your money works against you, not for you. Take the opportunity to map out your business plan and plot out an advertising strategy that will help you achieve those goals. Set your budget and never have to worry about shocking bank statements ever again.

 

Interested in learning more? Please call Advocate Digital Media or complete the contact us form on our site for a free digital marketing consultation. We’d love to learn more about your business and how our services can help you grow your bottom line!
Visit www.advocatedigital.com or call 1-855-322-3355.
And, check out our recent case study on Pandora, the streaming music titan. We want you to be in the know on the latest digital offerings and advertising options!

{{cta('45f25ac0-4b7e-48f6-bd36-2dc0ffb7e34c')}}
objects.rss_summary: It’s never a fun reality shock when you’re organizing your household budget and analyzing your monthly bank statements, and the total amount spent in the “restaurants” category strikes you in the face. The small purchases that you didn’t think would affect your bank ticker ended up eating a massive portion of your monthly and yearly income. According to a 2011 www.economywatch.com article, 57% of American households do not have a budget. Over half of us have no spending plan in place and the lack of a financial plan will undoubtedly invite spontaneous, and often reckless, spending. This all too pervasive habit not only means less money but it also prevents you from making smart, beneficial decisions with your money.
objects.title: Do You Know Where Your Money Is Going

objects.html_title: Instagram Live: New Ways to Share in the Moment
objects.label: Instagram Live: New Ways to Share in the Moment

meta.post_summary: Instagram heads into 2017 with a new addition to their platform – Instagram Live. What does this live video feed mean for your business?
meta.html_title: Instagram Live: New Ways to Share in the Moment
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Instagram heads into 2017 with a new addition to their platform – Instagram Live. What does this live video feed mean for your business? 

With over 100 million daily users, Instagram is becoming a must have social platform for all businesses. This image dominant social media site allows you to connect through visual images and hashtags. Wrapping up 2016, Instagram Stories made its debut – allowing users and businesses to post images and videos that have a 24-hour lifespan. 

 

Quickly following the launch of Instagram Stories, Instagram Live became available. This new feature provides the opportunity to stream real time videos similar to Facebook Live or Periscope on Twitter. One of the unique aspects of Instagram Live is that once the broadcast ends, it is no longer accessible. With the information quickly disappearing, a sense of urgency is created to be sure your followers log on to not miss out. Your followers are notified when you go “live” and they can post emojis and comments as your video plays on. This allows a deeper dive than what the follower would typically see within your feed. Here are three ways you can incorporate Instagram Live into your social media campaign:

 

  1. Behind the Scenes

Instagram Live can humanize your business and give followers an inside look to what goes on day to day within the business. At Advocate Digital Media, we encourage our customers to provide an insight on their social media pages that cultivate a personal relationship – followers want to see more than just a standard every day image. Recommendations often include bios about the staff, how products are made, staff events, or even business trips. Instagram Live is a deeper dive into that and provides the opportunity to humanize on another level – instant satisfaction.

 

  1. Live Demo/How your product works

The regular Instagram feed and stories have a limit of 1 minute for video. Instagram Live allows up to 1 hour of video interaction. This is an excellent time to show your followers a personalized demo or how to best use your products.

 

  1. Question and Answer Session

Instagram Live can be utilized to answer common questions that are often asked about your business or products. As you gain engaged followers, encourage them to send in questions and, of course, tune in when you are going live. While you are live, followers are able to post questions right on the live feed that you can answer. This feature allows immediate response and engaged followers to better understand your business.

 

Contact ADM today to talk about how to optimize your social media campaigns and best utilize the new feature of Instagram Live. And, check out our latest case study on Pandora, the streaming music titan. We want you in the know on the latest digital advertising options!

objects.html_title: Fact or Fiction: Small Town Consumers are Behind When it Comes to the Digital World
objects.label: Fact or Fiction: Small Town Consumers are Behind When it Comes to the Digital World

meta.post_summary: Helping small business owners with their digital strategies has proven to be a rewarding career. Many of my customers operate in small towns in south Texas and a question that has been posed on a couple of occasions is, “are small town consumers online?”
meta.html_title: Fact or Fiction: Small Town Consumers are Behind When it Comes to the Digital World
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Helping small business owners with their digital strategies has proven to be a rewarding career. Many of my customers operate in small towns in south Texas and a question that has been posed on a couple of occasions is, “are small town consumers online?”

 

Growing up in small towns my whole life, we sometimes joke that we’re “behind the times” and are last to have access to everything. Last to get the latest fashions. Last to get the cool restaurant chain. Last to get the new wine or craft beer selections. But is the same true of the Internet? Do consumers in smaller towns not have access to smartphones, laptops, LTE coverage and Internet service?

 

A quick Google search of a few small towns in South Texas shows that each have multiple stores where they can purchase smartphones, tablets and laptops. Both from major brand carriers, small independent dealers, and even Wal-Mart and Best Buy. Of course, there are no restrictions on where you have to buy your devices so some choose to order online or travel to their closest “big town”.

 

Phone carriers have done a great job over the last five years of expanding LTE coverage into rural America. Even areas once thought of as no mans land now have unfettered access to the Internet through LTE coverage on their phones and other mobile devices.

 

Cable companies too have invested billions into high-speed Internet access in an effort to diversify their services portfolio. It’s a critical component of their business model as Americans continue to “cut the cable cord” and now stream more content online. Even in small towns across Texas, cable companies provide broadband Internet access. In many of these small towns, there are often several other companies that also provide high-speed access.

 

In conclusion, here’s some interesting data to illustrate my point. Cuero is a small town in South Texas with a population of 7,005 based on the 2013 census. Guess how many active Facebook users are in Cuero? Around 5 - 6k!!!   While small, it’s obvious that residents of Cuero are not behind the times when it comes to being online. I’d be willing to bet Cuero is not the exception but the rule.

 

Interested in learning more? Please call Advocate Digital Media or complete the contact us form on our site for a free digital marketing consultation. We’d love to learn more about your business and how our services can help you grow your bottom line!

Visit www.advocatedigital.com or call 1-855-322-3355.

 

And, check out our recent case study on Pandora, the streaming music titan. We want you to be in the know on the latest digital offerings and advertising options!

Of course, there are no restrictions on where you have to buy your devices so some choose to order online or travel to their closest “big town”.

 

Phone carriers have done a great job over the last five years of expanding LTE coverage into rural America. Even areas once thought of as no mans land now have unfettered access to the Internet through LTE coverage on their phones and other mobile devices.

 

Cable companies too have invested billions into high-speed Internet access in an effort to diversify their services portfolio. It’s a critical component of their business model as Americans continue to “cut the cable cord” and now stream more content online. Even in small towns across Texas, cable companies provide broadband Internet access. In many of these small towns, there are often several other companies that also provide high-speed access.

 

In conclusion, here’s some interesting data to illustrate my point. Cuero is a small town in South Texas with a population of 7,005 based on the 2013 census. Guess how many active Facebook users are in Cuero? Around 5 - 6k!!!   While small, it’s obvious that residents of Cuero are not behind the times when it comes to being online. I’d be willing to bet Cuero is not the exception but the rule.

 

Interested in learning more? Please call Advocate Digital Media or complete the contact us form on our site for a free digital marketing consultation. We’d love to learn more about your business and how our services can help you grow your bottom line!

Visit www.advocatedigital.com or call 1-855-322-3355.

 

And, check out our recent case study on Pandora, the streaming music titan. We want you to be in the know on the latest digital offerings and advertising options!

objects.title: Fact or Fiction: Small Town Consumers are Behind When it Comes to the Digital World

objects.author: emily@advocatedigital.com
objects.html_title: Facebook Has an amazing product: you!
objects.label: Facebook Has an amazing product: you!

meta.post_body:
Did you know you're THE product?

It's often been said "If you don't pay for the product you become the product." As the underlying sophistication of digital advertising platforms becomes more evident this axum has never been more accurate.

In an out of character, semi transparent move Facebook admitted this week what we've all suspected: They know everything about you and they are creepy enough to use it. Facebook has been quietly catalogging and categorizing you, their product. So when you were sharing pictures of your cat eating the perfect tuna tar tar in your single family split level hoping you could get the time off at your new job downtown and take that cruise you just saw on Orbitz.

objects.html_title: ADM Rebrand FAQ
objects.label: ADM Rebrand FAQ

meta.post_summary:
Why the name change?

The name Advocate Digital Media has served us well over the years. However, as ADM has continued to grow in South and East Texas; in other markets; and with clients around the country, it made sense for us to rebrand now and prepare for future growth.
meta.html_title: ADM Rebrand FAQ
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Why the name change?

The name Advocate Digital Media has served us well over the years. However, as ADM has continued to grow in South and East Texas; in other markets; and with clients around the country, it made sense for us to rebrand now and prepare for future growth.

 

What is really changing?

Nothing is changing for our customers! Your trusted ADM account executives are ready and able to continue helping you market and grow your business. Our team of dedicated digital marketers and certified experts are continuing their award winning work on your behalf! Meet the team!

 

Are you no longer affiliated with local media companies?

The Victoria Advocate and other M. Roberts Media properties are now customers of Affect Digital Media. During this transition period, ADM will continue to support these properties.

 

What sets your products and services apart from the rest?

Affect Digital Media only provides premium products and services that are executed with your goals in mind. Many media companies try to offer cookie cutter solutions and “one size fits all” packages. That isn’t strategy and certainly won’t help you grow your business. Our process is very different!

 

What is next?

Great things are ahead! We have a number of new products and services that are rolling out now and great things are coming in 2018 for our customers! Online invoicing and bill pay, better reporting, and enhanced campaign integration are improvements our customers can look forward to!

 

What products and services do you offer?

If you’re not familiar with ADM, this is a great question! We offer everything from strategic services like media planning and budgeting to the tactics that ensure these strategies are successful and get the results you expect! We can handle as much or as little of your marketing efforts as you need!

 

Who is Affect Digital Media?

We are a dedicated team of marketing experts that concentrate on digital. ADM won the 2017 Local Media Association’s Digital Agency Of The Year and numerous national and regional awards over the past several years. Our team is made up of thought leaders, account executives, designers, developers, social media experts and Google certified fulfillment experts. We demand passion and expertise from our team and it shows in their work!

 

Who are your clients? What business types do you work with?

Chances are good that you know our clients. We work with some of the most successful brands in the market. You can check out our portfolio page for a taste of what we do. We work with huge companies like regional banks with hundreds of locations as well as very small businesses like single location bakeries and other “mom and pop” shops. ADM can help you compete with giant retail and online stores regardless of the size of your business.

 

Have more questions?

objects.html_title: Booming Social Media: Takeaways you can use today!
objects.label: Booming Social Media: Takeaways you can use today!

meta.post_body:
Wanting to extend your audience and thereby your customer base? It is a lofty goal with a potentially huge payoff. To most part-time marketers, this seems like a daunting task for good reasons. Actually achieving the goal requires expertise and a solid social media strategy.

The Port Lavaca Auto Group had just such a vision - to create an engaging presence across social media channels. They wanted to build that audience specifically on social media and then deliver branded messaging about their dealership, and product offers. They turned to Advocate Digital Media for help.

In this case study, learn how an auto dealer's barrier-breaking social media approach changed the chatter about their hometown: Booming Port Lavaca and gave them a steller social media platform to deliver their message.

See for yourself:
- Learn the steps Advocate Digital Media took to properly launch the social platforms
- Brainstorm ways you can apply this approach to your business
- Results speak for themselves with over 15K likes over the course of the year.
Read the full case study to see the step-by-step guide and results of this highly successful campaign.

objects.html_title: Nerds & Marketers Unite!
objects.label: Nerds & Marketers Unite!

meta.post_summary:
The list post is one of the most popular and readable blog formats on the web. It is composed of -- you guessed it -- a list, and includes short explanatory paragraphs about each item.

Use your introduction as a way to tell the reader how this collection of ideas will help them. Keep it light by including a personal story. If you have any data that you can include relating to your list, include that in your introduction, too.

Here are some examples of how we use list blog posts here at HubSpot:

  • The 7 Worst Types of Headlines (And How to Fix Them)
  • 5 Major Challenges Marketers Face (And How to Solve Them)
  • The Top 10 Qualities of High-Quality List Posts
meta.html_title: Nerds & Marketers Unite!
meta.post_body:
The list post is one of the most popular and readable blog formats on the web. It is composed of -- you guessed it -- a list, and includes short explanatory paragraphs about each item.

Use your introduction as a way to tell the reader how this collection of ideas will help them. Keep it light by including a personal story. If you have any data that you can include relating to your list, include that in your introduction, too.

Here are some examples of how we use list blog posts here at HubSpot:

  • The 7 Worst Types of Headlines (And How to Fix Them)
  • 5 Major Challenges Marketers Face (And How to Solve Them)
  • The Top 10 Qualities of High-Quality List Posts


BODY:

Now deliver what you promised in the first section. This is the longest part of the post, so make it easy to read. Use short paragraphs, bullet lists, and bold headings to set different sections apart.

Some common section headers include:

1. Reason #1 why writing a list-based post is helpful

2. Reason #2 why writing a list-based post is super helpful to your marketing

3. Reason #3 why everyone should be writing list-based posts

You can use bulleted lists, numbered list, or multiple headings. Include as many steps, numbers, or bullets that will allow you to discuss your topic thoroughly.

Here are some pointers to make the best possible body of your blog:
  • Include visuals
  • Include short explanatory phrases in your headers
  • At the end, transition into your conclusion


CONCLUSION:

Now it’s time to say goodbye and wrap up your post. Remind your readers of your key takeaway, reiterate what your readers need to do to get the desired result, and ask a question about how they see the topic to encourage comments and conversation. Don't forget to include a Call-to-Action!

Congratulations! What a lovely list post you've created!

objects.post_email_content:
The list post is one of the most popular and readable blog formats on the web. It is composed of -- you guessed it -- a list, and includes short explanatory paragraphs about each item.

Use your introduction as a way to tell the reader how this collection of ideas will help them. Keep it light by including a personal story. If you have any data that you can include relating to your list, include that in your introduction, too.

Here are some examples of how we use list blog posts here at HubSpot:

  • The 7 Worst Types of Headlines (And How to Fix Them)
  • 5 Major Challenges Marketers Face (And How to Solve Them)
  • The Top 10 Qualities of High-Quality List Posts

objects.author: jtholmes@advocatedigital.com
objects.html_title: How Are Local businesses Saving Thousands Of Dollars On Their Yellow Pages Advertising?
objects.label: How Are Local businesses Saving Thousands Of Dollars On Their Yellow Pages Advertising?

meta.post_summary: Think to yourself: when was the last time you picked up a phonebook to find the number of a business? Months? Years? A decade? Despite the disconnect, actual value vs. cost, yellow page companies are still raking in billions of dollars per year – particularly in local markets – from small and media sized businesses that are either afraid not to be listed or just don’t know any better.
meta.html_title: How Are Local businesses Saving Thousands Of Dollars On Their Yellow Pages Advertising?
meta.post_body:
Think to yourself: when was the last time you picked up a phonebook to find the number of a business? Months? Years? A decade? Despite the disconnect, actual value vs. cost, yellow page companies are still raking in billions of dollars per year – particularly in local markets – from small and media sized businesses that are either afraid not to be listed or just don’t know any better.

However, many businesses of all sizes are finally putting those dollars to better use. Digital solutions such as targeted display advertising, remarketing, social media management, contesting, inbound lead generation and a host of other digital options are capturing former Yellow Page dollars in droves. And for good reason – these tactics work!

So how do you, the business owner, start to recoup your advertising investment? The first step is to educate yourself. The following steps are a good guide:

  1. What modern advertising techniques are truly working and supplanting yellow page adverting?
  2. Learn more about your own customers. Who are they? Why do they buy from me? How often? How can I better support their needs?
  3. Once you’ve identified your current customers you need to think about how you can reach more people like them.
  4. Work with digital marketing experts to grow your customer base. Partner with someone that will teach you as much or as little as you’d like to learn.
  5. Avoid unscrupulous marketing and media companies rely on uneducated customers that don’t understand digital or what they are selling. Our team always recommends that you understand what you’re spending your budget on. You don’t need to be an expert but you should have a general understanding of digital tactics.

If you’re a current yellow pages customer you’ve likely been pitched on their digital solutions. A word of caution here. Yellow Page companies are shifting to digital, while bundling their print products with cookie cutter digital campaigns. They bundle Google Ad Words, Display, reputation management and other “buzzword compliant” digital advertising methods with their ineffective print products in order to hit a quota. It hasn’t been working. In 2011 Dex and SuperMedia had to file bankruptcy in order to complete their merger. But the troubles don’t end there for yellow page companies. Just last month Hibu, a UK yellow page company that operates here in the U.S., filed for bankruptcy protection for the second time in two years.

We’ve worked directly with hundreds of customers and former customers of these massive legacy yellow page companies. Over that time we’ve learned that high pressure sales tactics and subpar, intentionally confusing products are at alive and well. We’re here to help.

meta.html_title: Sample - How To Post 6
meta.post_body:
INTRODUCTION:

Your “how to” blog post should teach the reader how to do something by breaking it down into a series of steps.

Begin your blog post by explaining what problem you are going to solve through your explanation and be sure to include any relevant keywords. Add in a personal story to establish your credibility on this topic. And make sure to end your blog post with a summary of what your reader will gain by following your lead.

Need some inspiration? Check out these "How-To" examples from the HubSpot blog:

  • How to Write a Blog Post: A Simple Formula to Follow
  • How to Do Keyword Research: A Beginner's Guide
  • How to Write an Effective Meta Description (Yes, They Still Matter)


BODY:

Now deliver what you promised in the first section. This is the longest part of the post, so make it easy to read. Use short paragraphs, bullet lists, and bold headings to set different sections apart. 

Some common section headers include:

Step 1: Getting Started

Step 2: Do Your Background Research on…

Step 3: First Steps for…

Step 4: Analyze and Repeat

Step 5: Wrapping Up

You can use bulleted lists, numbered list, or multiple headings. Include as many steps, numbers, or bullets that will allow you to discuss your topic thoroughly.

Here are some pointers to make the best possible body of your blog:
  • Include visuals
  • Include short explanatory phrases in your headers
  • At the end, transition into your conclusion


CONCLUSION:

Now it’s time to say goodbye and wrap up your post. Remind your readers of your key takeaway, reiterate what your readers need to do to get the desired result, and ask a question about how they see the topic to encourage comments and conversation. Don't forget to add a Call-to-Action to turn your blog post into a marketing machine!

Congratulations! What a lovely how-to post you've created.

objects.post_body:
INTRODUCTION:

Your “how to” blog post should teach the reader how to do something by breaking it down into a series of steps.

Begin your blog post by explaining what problem you are going to solve through your explanation and be sure to include any relevant keywords. Add in a personal story to establish your credibility on this topic. And make sure to end your blog post with a summary of what your reader will gain by following your lead.

Need some inspiration? Check out these "How-To" examples from the HubSpot blog:

  • How to Write a Blog Post: A Simple Formula to Follow
  • How to Do Keyword Research: A Beginner's Guide
  • How to Write an Effective Meta Description (Yes, They Still Matter)


BODY:

Now deliver what you promised in the first section. This is the longest part of the post, so make it easy to read. Use short paragraphs, bullet lists, and bold headings to set different sections apart. 

Some common section headers include:

Step 1: Getting Started

Step 2: Do Your Background Research on…

Step 3: First Steps for…

Step 4: Analyze and Repeat

Step 5: Wrapping Up

You can use bulleted lists, numbered list, or multiple headings. Include as many steps, numbers, or bullets that will allow you to discuss your topic thoroughly.

Here are some pointers to make the best possible body of your blog:
  • Include visuals
  • Include short explanatory phrases in your headers
  • At the end, transition into your conclusion


CONCLUSION:

Now it’s time to say goodbye and wrap up your post. Remind your readers of your key takeaway, reiterate what your readers need to do to get the desired result, and ask a question about how they see the topic to encourage comments and conversation. Don't forget to add a Call-to-Action to turn your blog post into a marketing machine!

Congratulations! What a lovely how-to post you've created.

objects.post_body:
INTRODUCTION:

Your “how to” blog post should teach the reader how to do something by breaking it down into a series of steps.

Begin your blog post by explaining what problem you are going to solve through your explanation and be sure to include any relevant keywords. Add in a personal story to establish your credibility on this topic. And make sure to end your blog post with a summary of what your reader will gain by following your lead.

Need some inspiration? Check out these "How-To" examples from the HubSpot blog:

  • How to Write a Blog Post: A Simple Formula to Follow
  • How to Do Keyword Research: A Beginner's Guide
  • How to Write an Effective Meta Description (Yes, They Still Matter)


BODY:

Now deliver what you promised in the first section. This is the longest part of the post, so make it easy to read. Use short paragraphs, bullet lists, and bold headings to set different sections apart. 

Some common section headers include:

Step 1: Getting Started

Step 2: Do Your Background Research on…

Step 3: First Steps for…

Step 4: Analyze and Repeat

Step 5: Wrapping Up

You can use bulleted lists, numbered list, or multiple headings. Include as many steps, numbers, or bullets that will allow you to discuss your topic thoroughly.

Here are some pointers to make the best possible body of your blog:
  • Include visuals
  • Include short explanatory phrases in your headers
  • At the end, transition into your conclusion


CONCLUSION:

Now it’s time to say goodbye and wrap up your post. Remind your readers of your key takeaway, reiterate what your readers need to do to get the desired result, and ask a question about how they see the topic to encourage comments and conversation. Don't forget to add a Call-to-Action to turn your blog post into a marketing machine!

Congratulations! What a lovely how-to post you've created.

objects.post_body:
INTRODUCTION:

Your “how to” blog post should teach the reader how to do something by breaking it down into a series of steps.

Begin your blog post by explaining what problem you are going to solve through your explanation and be sure to include any relevant keywords. Add in a personal story to establish your credibility on this topic. And make sure to end your blog post with a summary of what your reader will gain by following your lead.

Need some inspiration? Check out these "How-To" examples from the HubSpot blog:

  • How to Write a Blog Post: A Simple Formula to Follow
  • How to Do Keyword Research: A Beginner's Guide
  • How to Write an Effective Meta Description (Yes, They Still Matter)


BODY:

Now deliver what you promised in the first section. This is the longest part of the post, so make it easy to read. Use short paragraphs, bullet lists, and bold headings to set different sections apart. 

Some common section headers include:

Step 1: Getting Started

Step 2: Do Your Background Research on…

Step 3: First Steps for…

Step 4: Analyze and Repeat

Step 5: Wrapping Up

You can use bulleted lists, numbered list, or multiple headings. Include as many steps, numbers, or bullets that will allow you to discuss your topic thoroughly.

Here are some pointers to make the best possible body of your blog:
  • Include visuals
  • Include short explanatory phrases in your headers
  • At the end, transition into your conclusion


CONCLUSION:

Now it’s time to say goodbye and wrap up your post. Remind your readers of your key takeaway, reiterate what your readers need to do to get the desired result, and ask a question about how they see the topic to encourage comments and conversation. Don't forget to add a Call-to-Action to turn your blog post into a marketing machine!

Congratulations! What a lovely how-to post you've created.

objects.html_title: 5 Tips to Marketing to Millennials
objects.label: 5 Tips to Marketing to Millennials

meta.post_summary: Looking to reach millennials online? This vast age group, 18-34, has $1.3 trillion in annual buying power, making it a great target audience. However, marketers tend to be led astray by the many preconceived notions about their personality and interests.
meta.html_title: 5 Tips to Marketing to Millennials
meta.post_body:
Looking to reach millennials online? This vast age group, 18-34, has $1.3 trillion in annual buying power, making it a great target audience. However, marketers tend to be led astray by the many preconceived notions about their personality and interests.

 

U.S. millennials are diverse so the more you can define your target audience, the more ROI you will see. However, there are some common characteristics that will help you reach nearly all millennials.

 

Be authentic.

Millennials trust what they feel is authentic. Make your message as though it came from one of them and incorporate their language. Their attention will be sparked by reading posts that could have come from one of their friends. Millennials connect best with people over logos.

 

Mobile Mobile Mobile

64% of American adults own a smartphone of some kind and 85% of young adults use one. Not only that, but more than 50% of millennials are using their phones to make a mobile purchase.

Source

 

Since April 2015, Google rankings have been affected by the mobile-friendliness of a website. Make sure your landing page is mobile-friendly and your website is easy to navigate on a phone.

 

Use Content Marketing and reach them where they’re at

Native advertising articles provide a way for advertisers to pull millennials in with engaging content -- but the key is just that. Be engaging and add value. Show these potential customers a solution to a problem they may not even know they had and that your product is the best option out there.

 

Engage with them on social media

62% of millennials say that if a brand engages with them on social networks, they are more likely to become a loyal customer. So have a social media strategy in place to interact with your social media followers and mentions! It can be time-intensive but will be well-worth your time.

 

It’s all about their experience

Millennials crave the experience of shopping more than the purchase.  With online browsing a means to an end, 40% of millennials make wish lists of products they want to buy. Pinterest is a perfect example of how the shopping journey is also an act of personal expression.

objects.html_title: Digital Strategy — Not Just for Big Business
objects.label: Digital Strategy — Not Just for Big Business

meta.html_title: Digital Strategy — Not Just for Big Business
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
With the advent of e-commerce, national brands were forced to rethink and redesign their advertising in order to compete with online competition or face extinction.  For small businesses, adaptation has been slow moving, even resisted, despite the fiber optic speeds of technological change.  Most have been keen to continue with the old way of doing things, including the traditional advertising avenues they have been used to for decades. 

            10 years ago, the Palm Pilot and Blackberry PDAs were the pinnacles of the smartphone world.  Online shopping was, for the most part, exclusively eBay, accessed at home on the desktop computer.  Entertainment was consumed via cable television, FM radio and CD/DVD players. Today, nearly every single aspect of our lives is tied to a single device we carry in our pocket or purse. 

Many business owners are left bewildered as to how to even go about strategizing for digital advertising. Fortunately, there are a few things to keep in mind when beginning to plan for an advertising overhaul.

Websites – 101: Entry to Responsive

It is no secret that websites are the new brick & mortar stores.  Google has become the instinctive go-to for consumers seeking information.  Whether it’s about a particular business or a product, nearly every web user has been conditioned to consult Google for all their answers – and the destination they are seeking is an easy-to-navigate, informational website.

In 2015, mobile traffic overtook desktop traffic for the first time and Google started pushing responsive websites to the top of their results — pushing down websites that only work on desktop.  The point: a website is the obvious first step for business owners looking to reach today’s consumers but, ultimately, a mobile responsive website is critical for a business and their products or services. 

Social Media

In the blink of a digital eye, a vast majority of American consumers of all age groups have transitioned over to the social media universe. Businesses could not ask for a better scenario than to be able to instantly communicate directly with a considerable percentage of their target population! According to a report by IStrategyLabs.com, adults aged 35-54 make up the largest majority of Facebook users at 31.1%.  Below that are adults aged 25-34 at 24.4%.

¡Targeting! ¡Targeting! ¡Targeting!

Data is now easily accessible to advertisers who want to be able to deliver their brand DIRECTLY to their ideal customer.  Whether it is a call to action or a simple branding campaign, a display ad or a video spot, this digital world allows brands and advertisers to deliver content directly to their targeted audience.

             Many businesses have been hesitant to adapt due to what can be the overwhelming nature of the digital beast.  However, the opportunities for businesses and consumers to interact with one another are now possible on a scale unlike ever before.  The times are changing and so must the business model.  Now is the time to adapt.
meta.rss_body:
With the advent of e-commerce, national brands were forced to rethink and redesign their advertising in order to compete with online competition or face extinction.  For small businesses, adaptation has been slow moving, even resisted, despite the fiber optic speeds of technological change.  Most have been keen to continue with the old way of doing things, including the traditional advertising avenues they have been used to for decades. 

            10 years ago, the Palm Pilot and Blackberry PDAs were the pinnacles of the smartphone world.  Online shopping was, for the most part, exclusively eBay, accessed at home on the desktop computer.  Entertainment was consumed via cable television, FM radio and CD/DVD players. Today, nearly every single aspect of our lives is tied to a single device we carry in our pocket or purse. 

Many business owners are left bewildered as to how to even go about strategizing for digital advertising. Fortunately, there are a few things to keep in mind when beginning to plan for an advertising overhaul.

Websites – 101: Entry to Responsive

It is no secret that websites are the new brick & mortar stores.  Google has become the instinctive go-to for consumers seeking information.  Whether it’s about a particular business or a product, nearly every web user has been conditioned to consult Google for all their answers – and the destination they are seeking is an easy-to-navigate, informational website.

In 2015, mobile traffic overtook desktop traffic for the first time and Google started pushing responsive websites to the top of their results — pushing down websites that only work on desktop.  The point: a website is the obvious first step for business owners looking to reach today’s consumers but, ultimately, a mobile responsive website is critical for a business and their products or services. 

Social Media

In the blink of a digital eye, a vast majority of American consumers of all age groups have transitioned over to the social media universe. Businesses could not ask for a better scenario than to be able to instantly communicate directly with a considerable percentage of their target population! According to a report by IStrategyLabs.com, adults aged 35-54 make up the largest majority of Facebook users at 31.1%.  Below that are adults aged 25-34 at 24.4%.

¡Targeting! ¡Targeting! ¡Targeting!

Data is now easily accessible to advertisers who want to be able to deliver their brand DIRECTLY to their ideal customer.  Whether it is a call to action or a simple branding campaign, a display ad or a video spot, this digital world allows brands and advertisers to deliver content directly to their targeted audience.

             Many businesses have been hesitant to adapt due to what can be the overwhelming nature of the digital beast.  However, the opportunities for businesses and consumers to interact with one another are now possible on a scale unlike ever before.  The times are changing and so must the business model.  Now is the time to adapt.

objects.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.

objects.html_title: Have You Swallowed The Red Pill?
objects.label: Have You Swallowed The Red Pill?

meta.post_summary: In the classic sci-fi movie The Matrix, the main character Neo is given a choice that sets up the whole movie: swallow the Red Pill and see the world for what it is or take the Blue Pill and continue to live in ignorance, seeing the world as he has always believe it existed. You probably remember or can guess the outcome. Our hero chooses the Red Pill, and it’s a painful choice.
meta.html_title: Have You Swallowed The Red Pill?
meta.meta_description: Local business owners need to the shift to digital advertising before it's too late. Newspaper and TV advertising is not as effective as it once was.
meta.post_body:
In the classic sci-fi movie The Matrix, the main character Neo is given a choice that sets up the whole movie: swallow the Red Pill and see the world for what it is or take the Blue Pill and continue to live in ignorance, seeing the world as he has always believe it existed. You probably remember or can guess the outcome. Our hero chooses the Red Pill, and it’s a painful choice.

So how can this movie scene possibly relate to marketing? If you think of our digital culture as the way the world really is and the traditional media landscape as the “Blue Pill” world you thought you knew, then this analogy fits well. Just imagine how painful it can be for a business owner with a limited marketing budget to “wake up” and realize their expensive, traditional advertising spend isn’t as effective as it used to be while further learning they aren’t reaching anyone in the digital culture. Not as bad as waking to the post apocalyptic existence faced by Neo, but an expensive dream nonetheless.

Now I can hear some of you saying “well that might be true for ‘Techies’ that watch The Matrix but…” To which I say, the lowly banner ad is 21 years old. The Matrix is nearly 17 years old. If Google were a person it would be old enough vote in the next presidential election! The digital culture is no longer new. In fact, the digital culture is mainstream and ubiquitous.

Look around your stores. People are on their phones, shopping for the very products you carry, right on your showroom floor. Do you not think they’re doing the same thing at home on their tablet or phone?

We live in a time of unprecedented disruption.

  • Digital publishing, tablets and phones have disrupted newspapers and magazines.
  • Over the air radio has been disrupted by satellite and more dramatically Internet radio alternatives like Pandora, Spotify and Apple Radio.
  • Broadcast TV is at the precipice of a massive disruption as streaming devices like Roku, Apple TV and Chromecast, along with accompanying content services like Hulu, Netflix and Amazon are now squarely in the mainstream. Even market leaders such as ESPN are bracing for massive layoffs as consumers rapidly unplug from pay TV and skip through commercials on their favorite primetime shows.

The question you need to ask yourself as a local marketer is this: “Do I want to continue to see the world as it was or as it really is?” There’s really only one answer. If you want to attract new business and add new customers you must embrace change and in a big way. Time to take the Red Pill.

objects.author: deepti@thewebplant.com
objects.html_title: Pokémon Go provides opportunities for local businesses
objects.label: Pokémon Go provides opportunities for local businesses

meta.html_title: Pokémon Go provides opportunities for local businesses
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
If you’re a local business owner and haven’t checked out Pokémon Go yet, you’re missing out on a big opportunity to increase your customer base.

The day after Pokémon Go was released, it was installed on more Android phones in the United States than the popular dating app Tinder. Over 60% of people who have downloaded the app in the US are using it daily. This means about 3% of the entire US Android population are on the app every day, putting it neck and neck with Twitter’s daily active users.

Pokémon Go uses your phone’s GPS and camera and turns the real world into a hunting ground for Pokémon but also transforms local businesses and locations into Pokémon Gyms (where trainers go to train their Pokémon and battle other teams) and PokéStops, which players can physically visit to stock up on free accessories and items like PokéBalls.

If your business is a PokéStop or Gym, then you’ve probably already noticed an increase in foot traffic and therefore potential customers. If that’s the case, get into the spirit of the game and welcome players inside!

Perhaps you have a café or coffee shop that is a PokéStop. Create a Pokémon-inspired drink or dish! Or you can offer a deal to customers who show you they are at your location on the app.

Pokémon Go also has an in-game item called a “Lure Module” that attracts Pokémon (and trainers!) to a particular PokéStop for 30 minutes. This can be purchased and would be perfect for a typically slow period of your day in order to entice more foot traffic. You can easily advertise the time on Facebook beforehand—a perfect promotion to pull players in who will know ahead of time where to hunt a bunch of Pokémon!

Is your business not a PokéStop? Don’t worry! In the future, sponsored locations will be available in Pokémon Go. The developers will also later accept locations to be considered as Gyms or PokéStops via their support page.

objects.html_title: Advocate Digital Media creates mobile application for 2016 South Texas Transportation Conference
objects.label: Advocate Digital Media creates mobile application for 2016 South Texas Transportation Conference

meta.html_title: Advocate Digital Media creates mobile application for 2016 South Texas Transportation Conference
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
The Victoria Chamber of Commerce’s 2016 South Texas Transportation Conference presented by CivilCorp will have more than just the speakers and exhibits—this year’s attendees can download a mobile application for their smartphone to keep them up to date with what’s going on around the conference set for August 11 at the Victoria College Conference and Education Center.

The app, developed by the team at Advocate Digital Media, includes a schedule, details on the speakers and a place to check in. It also has information on the venue, as well as accommodations for out-of-town attendees.

“Given the tech theme of the conference and the visionary leaders organizing the event, it seemed fitting to have our team develop an app that would be a useful tool both prior to and during the event,” Jason Holmes, general manager of Advocate Digital Media said. “Advocate Digital Media is about incorporating useful technology into local events and causes to heighten awareness and help communicate effectively to attendees.”

Presentations scheduled for the conference will cover a wide range of transportation areas of interest, including TxDOT road innovations, Uber and keynote address from Allie Medack, General Motor’s Chief of Staff for Global Public Policy. A full agenda can be found by downloading the South Texas Transportation Conference app in the App Store, Google Play, and iTunes.

“We are very appreciative of the support ADM has provided to the Transportation Committee. This year, our goal was to present a conference that showcases innovations in transportation,” said Ben Galvan, president of CivilCorp, LLC and chairman of the transportation committee. “The conference app is a great tool that fits our theme and adds value to the overall conference experience. We are very appreciative of ADM partnering with us to develop the app.”

The 2016 South Texas Transportation Conference will take place August 11 at the Victoria College Conference and Education Center. Those wishing to attend can pre- register at www.stxtranscon.com.

“Given the tech theme of the conference and the visionary leaders organizing the event, it seemed fitting to have our team develop an app that would be a useful tool both prior to and during the event,” Jason Holmes, general manager of Advocate Digital Media said. “Advocate Digital Media is about incorporating useful technology into local events and causes to heighten awareness and help communicate effectively to attendees.”

Presentations scheduled for the conference will cover a wide range of transportation areas of interest, including TxDOT road innovations, Uber and keynote address from Allie Medack, General Motor’s Chief of Staff for Global Public Policy. A full agenda can be found by downloading the South Texas Transportation Conference app in the App Store, Google Play, and iTunes.

“We are very appreciative of the support ADM has provided to the Transportation Committee. This year, our goal was to present a conference that showcases innovations in transportation,” said Ben Galvan, president of CivilCorp, LLC and chairman of the transportation committee. “The conference app is a great tool that fits our theme and adds value to the overall conference experience. We are very appreciative of ADM partnering with us to develop the app.”

The 2016 South Texas Transportation Conference will take place August 11 at the Victoria College Conference and Education Center. Those wishing to attend can pre- register at www.stxtranscon.com.

blog_author.bio: It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution of letters, as opposed to using 'Content here, content here', making it look like readable English.

objects.campaign_name: Sample - My first inbound campaign in HubSpot
objects.html_title: Sample - How To Post
objects.label: Sample - How To Post

meta.meta_description: This is the meta description of your first post.
meta.html_title: Sample - How To Post
meta.post_body:
INTRODUCTION:

Your “how to” blog post should teach the reader how to do something by breaking it down into a series of steps.

Begin your blog post by explaining what problem you are going to solve through your explanation and be sure to include any relevant keywords. Add in a personal story to establish your credibility on this topic. And make sure to end your blog post with a summary of what your reader will gain by following your lead.

Need some inspiration? Check out these "How-To" examples from the HubSpot blog:

  • How to Write a Blog Post: A Simple Formula to Follow
  • How to Do Keyword Research: A Beginner's Guide
  • How to Write an Effective Meta Description (Yes, They Still Matter)


BODY:

Now deliver what you promised in the first section. This is the longest part of the post, so make it easy to read. Use short paragraphs, bullet lists, and bold headings to set different sections apart. 

Some common section headers include:

Step 1: Getting Started

Step 2: Do Your Background Research on…

Step 3: First Steps for…

Step 4: Analyze and Repeat

Step 5: Wrapping Up

You can use bulleted lists, numbered list, or multiple headings. Include as many steps, numbers, or bullets that will allow you to discuss your topic thoroughly.

Here are some pointers to make the best possible body of your blog:
  • Include visuals
  • Include short explanatory phrases in your headers
  • At the end, transition into your conclusion


CONCLUSION:

Now it’s time to say goodbye and wrap up your post. Remind your readers of your key takeaway, reiterate what your readers need to do to get the desired result, and ask a question about how they see the topic to encourage comments and conversation. Don't forget to add a Call-to-Action to turn your blog post into a marketing machine!

Congratulations! What a lovely how-to post you've created.
