objects.author: deepti@thewebplant.com
objects.html_title: Could there be something better than a click-through rate?
objects.label: Could there be something better than a click-through rate?

meta.html_title: Could there be something better than a click-through rate?
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Since the beginning of digital advertising, we have been conditioned to think about the click-through rate as the best way to gauge a successful campaign. But is there another way? With today’s sophisticated targeting and tracking tactics, there is definitely more to look at and think about.

 

Most people do not click on digital display ads. The real value of targeted display advertising is the ability to expose people to your brand where they spend most of their time online. Before the digital age, no one was able to click on print ads, TV ads, or radio ads.  You placed your messages there to reach people where they spent an enormous amount of time. It’s no different with digital display ads. You are exposing people to your message, which in this day and age is online. In fact, on average Americans spend over 150 hours per month consuming online content.

 

Your click-through rate (CTR) is the percentage of clicks on an ad divided by the number of times it has been displayed. When someone sees a display ad while surfing the web, they may click and are then directed to the advertiser’s website. This is presented as a percentage in monthly reporting.

 

View through traffic, however, is when a person sees an ad online and does not click on the ad, but was influenced by it. They later find their way to the brand’s website, either by a Google search or by going directly to the website. This is tracked through a view-through pixel placed on your homepage.

 

Research and analytics show someone is up to 1900% more likely to view your ad, not click it, and come in to your business than someone who clicked your ad. This can also be tracked using specialized reporting. The power of display advertising is in the view. Not the click.

 

Advocate Digital Media provides you in-depth monthly reporting to show you exactly how your campaign is performing and a complete picture of the health of your digital campaign.  Have a conversation with your digital rep today about adding these components to your digital strategy.

objects.author: deepti@thewebplant.com
objects.html_title: What a good logo can do for your business
objects.label: What a good logo can do for your business

meta.html_title: What a good logo can do for your business
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
What visuals come to mind when you think of a particular car dealership, hospital, or even your favorite clothing store? Most likely you know what their logo looks like or maybe the specific color that their advertising consistently showcases. These different aspects of branding are important to create consistent messaging and begin the overall customer experience. 

As we analyze branding, the first thing we want to look at is your logo. Your logo is present on all advertising, marketing materials and business related information. It is important that your logo is simple and easy to read. In a recent discussion I had with ADM’s lead designer, Vicki Holmes, she mentioned that there are three main things to consider when creating your logo: 

1.     Style – The style of your logo should take into consideration what industry your business is in and who is the intended audience. For example, a hospital would have a much more sophisticated logo with a clean look, compared to a children’s daycare, which would be more colorful and fun. 

2.     Color Scheme –What color or colors do you want associated with your business? The colors should not be too light or too close to the colors your competitors use. It should also be taken into consideration how the logo will be used – outdoor signage, embroidery, business cards, etc. 

3.     Tagline – Often we will find that a logo itself does not explain what a business actually does. A tagline can be important to explain to the consumer what your business has to offer them. 

Once your logo has been created, you are ready to look at the overall branding of your business. Branding should always be cohesive regardless of the type of media you are advertising in. This ensures that the consumer will recognize your business wherever they see it. 

 ADM will often work with businesses on rebranding. Sometimes the business has changed owners or it just needs a new, refreshed look. ADM is here to help in that process. We can assist the business owner by collecting all different types of logos or non-cohesive ads that have been running and discuss which features are the strongest. Working with our team of designers, we create a variety of logos and once one is decided on, we will provide a style guide that can be used and sent out to anyone creating something for the company. A style guide provides the fonts, colors and any specific instructions regarding the logo and branding of the business.

What visuals come to mind when you think of a particular car dealership, hospital, or even your favorite clothing store? Most likely you know what their logo looks like or maybe the specific color that their advertising consistently showcases. These different aspects of branding are important to create consistent messaging and begin the overall customer experience. 

As we analyze branding, the first thing we want to look at is your logo. Your logo is present on all advertising, marketing materials and business related information. It is important that your logo is simple and easy to read. In a recent discussion I had with ADM’s lead designer, Vicki Holmes, she mentioned that there are three main things to consider when creating your logo: 

1.     Style – The style of your logo should take into consideration what industry your business is in and who is the intended audience. For example, a hospital would have a much more sophisticated logo with a clean look, compared to a children’s daycare, which would be more colorful and fun. 

2.     Color Scheme –What color or colors do you want associated with your business? The colors should not be too light or too close to the colors your competitors use. It should also be taken into consideration how the logo will be used – outdoor signage, embroidery, business cards, etc. 

3.     Tagline – Often we will find that a logo itself does not explain what a business actually does. A tagline can be important to explain to the consumer what your business has to offer them. 

Once your logo has been created, you are ready to look at the overall branding of your business. Branding should always be cohesive regardless of the type of media you are advertising in. This ensures that the consumer will recognize your business wherever they see it. 

 ADM will often work with businesses on rebranding. Sometimes the business has changed owners or it just needs a new, refreshed look. ADM is here to help in that process. We can assist the business owner by collecting all different types of logos or non-cohesive ads that have been running and discuss which features are the strongest. Working with our team of designers, we create a variety of logos and once one is decided on, we will provide a style guide that can be used and sent out to anyone creating something for the company. A style guide provides the fonts, colors and any specific instructions regarding the logo and branding of the business.
objects.title: What a good logo can do for your business

objects.author: deepti@thewebplant.com
objects.html_title: Native Advertising Helps Defeat Adblockers
objects.label: Native Advertising Helps Defeat Adblockers

meta.html_title: Native Advertising Helps Defeat Adblockers
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
There’s a new trend on the internet that could mean bad news for advertisers- ad blocking software. Ad blocker usage grew to 48% in the United States last year. In fact, 12.4% of Texans use some sort of ad blocker. Millennials are the most likely to use one, with 18-24 year-olds at the greatest numbers and 25-34 year-olds close behind.  However, there is a way around the ad blockers that is great news for advertisers--native advertising.

Native advertising is most typically seen as a sponsored or branded article on news websites and is a true win-win for everyone. Because it bypasses ad filtering systems by blurring the line between content and advertising, native advertising lets readers experience a less cluttered website and makes readers more likely to pay attention. This method also allows businesses to get their message in front of consumers in a more appealing way than the “traditional” online methods.

Ad-blocking technology is helping the digital landscape by forcing advertisers to try new techniques and create content and experiences that consumers actually want to engage with. While this is a change for those accustomed to banner ads, native advertising allows brands to connect with audiences in an authentic and less disruptive way. In fact, according to a new Business Insider report, native advertising will be dominant in 2016 and will even drive 74% of all ad revenue by  2021.

While examples of this can be seen on a national scale with posts on Buzzfeed, theNew York Times and more, local advertisers can reach and maximize audiences in this innovative way. Here at Advocate Digital Media, we help businesses create engaging content on both the VictoriaAdvocate.com and the Longview News-Journal.com.Articles that live on the website of these news organizations continue to reach audiences for months after their publication date, a great long-term investment for any business. For more information on local native advertising, go to our websitewww.advocatedigitalmedia.com or call us at 1-855-322-3355.

objects.html_title: Advocate Digital Media to Serve as 2016 Longview Business Solutions Conference Presenting Sponsor
objects.label: Advocate Digital Media to Serve as 2016 Longview Business Solutions Conference Presenting Sponsor

meta.html_title: Advocate Digital Media to Serve as 2016 Longview Business Solutions Conference Presenting Sponsor
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Advocate Digital Media, a full-service advertising agency located in Longview, is proud to return as the presenting sponsor of the Longview Chamber of Commerce’s Business Solutions Conference 2016.

The conference is scheduled for May 3 at the Maude Cobb Convention Center.

East Texas industry leaders are invited to attend to gain the latest insights, build lasting connections and take advantage of the great educational sessions.

“This is a fantastic opportunity to partner with the Longview Chamber of Commerce to help educate the business community on the latest trends and developments in advertising and digital marketing, “Jennifer Love, Digital Sales Director for Advocate Digital Media, said.

Attendees for the one-day event are invited to begin arriving at 7:30 a.m. for the Business Breakfast featuring Eric Ellis and the first round of sessions starting at 8:45 a.m. and to visit the expo floor. There are four main areas of educational sessions: business development, professional development, technology, and business strategies.

“With topics ranging from entrepreneurship to building market share, these one hour sessions will be packed with powerful takeaways, “ Love said.


Keynote speaker, Eric Ellis, will be presenting “Building a Culture of Respect”, sure to be a highlight of the event. The keynote luncheon will be held from 11:30 to 1:00 p.m. 

Learn more and register now to attend at LongviewChamber.com or call Leska Parker at 903-918-1546. View the event overview video: https://youtu.be/A1JnroaAlYE

“At Advocate Digital Media, we want our clients to be informed on the shifting media landscape. By partnering on this conference, we feel we are sharing emerging trends not only with our clients, but also with business owners in the area that can greatly benefit from learning more about the landscape,“ Love said.

objects.html_title: Large Turnout at ADM’s Business After Hours
objects.label: Large Turnout at ADM’s Business After Hours

meta.html_title: Large Turnout at ADM’s Business After Hours
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Advocate Digital Media, a full-service digital agency and Google Partner, recently hosted a ribbon cutting and business after hours event with the Victoria Chamber of Commerce at ADM’s new office space on the second floor of the CivilCorp building, located at 4611 E. Airline Road in Victoria. Over 200 were in attendance to see the new space, network and meet members of the Advocate Digital Media team. 

 


 

“This move is a continuation of our shift in the past two years to a full-service digital advertising agency, “ said Jason Holmes, general manager of ADM. “We were thrilled with the turnout and the opportunity to show the business community our new modern space.” 

 


 

Location was one of the key determining factors in selecting CivilCorp for ADM’s new headquarters. “We sought out a space in a developing area of Victoria. Given the location close to Victoria’s transportation infrastructure - Loop 463, John Stockbauer and Houston Highway - our team can quickly access our clients’ businesses and vice versa,” Holmes said. 

 


 

The new space has a modern layout with clean lines, using glass and a contemporary color scheme. One of the most notable highlights is the open workspace where the developers, fulfillment and creative teams will be housed. The space supports collaboration between our production team in new and exciting ways. With large windows overlooking the Colony Creek Country Club golf course, the copious amount of natural light pouring into the space are a welcomed change of scenery. If you didn't have a chance to attend the event, please stop by for a tour and met the ADM team.

objects.html_title: Making Promotional Products Work for Your Business
objects.label: Making Promotional Products Work for Your Business

meta.html_title: Making Promotional Products Work for Your Business
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
At Advocate Digital Media, we really do it all. We are a full-service advertising agency. The best part: you don’t have to be a client to receive typical agency services. That means we can design and print business cards, brochures, posters, postcards, special event invites and materials as well as order unique promotional products. 

You may be asking yourself: “Why do I need to order pens, coffee mugs, notepads, cups, etc for my business?” The answer: these are tangible items that people can hold in their hands and interact with that are branded with your logo/your business identity. And, if you spend some time diving into your target market, you can select items that are specific to their needs. This means that consumers will be interacting with your brand on a regular basis which helps drive a nice return on investment and remembrance of your brand.

What’s unique about promotional products is there ability to take an ordinary message – say traditional branding – and turn it into an experience. A solution when you need a pen handy or an insulated tumbler to keep that drink cool. It’s your identity in mobile form – your brand out in the world, being experienced by your customers.


Don’t believe they work? Here are a few tidbits to marinate on – 8 out of 10 people own between 1 and 10 promotional products and 53% note they have used a promo item at least once a week. One out of four walk around with promo products on or with them and 81% keep them because they are useful!

 


Recently, we worked with several clients on their booth materials for the Home and Garden Show held at the Victoria Community Center. Each brought unique challenges. They needed to attract qualified leads to their booth and give them information to take that had a strong call to action. The solution? We developed several pieces including rack cards with general information; call to action tear offs with business cards at the bottom and cookies with the company’s logo. Talk about a conversation starter! 

 



Next time you plan on having a booth at an event, think about your total investment not just the cost of the booth space. Plan ahead to include quality educational materials about your business that features award-winning captivating design. Think about the first impression of your booth – your signage, your tablecloth, your door prize, your offering to draw them over, etc. Then, make a call to ADM to develop a comprehensive plan to get the most out of your investment. 

Do you know that you need some simple promo products to pass out but not sure how to budget or want to do something unique? Let’s visit. We always look for the latest trends in promotional products that are affordable, high quality and unique. After all, you don’t want to pass out the same pen that everyone else has in the market. You want to leave a lasting impression and with the right promotional products targeted to your specific audience, you can do just that.

objects.html_title: Highlights from Advocate Digital Media & UHV SBDC’S Digital Media Expo 2016
objects.label: Highlights from Advocate Digital Media & UHV SBDC’S Digital Media Expo 2016

meta.post_summary: Advocate Digital Media, a full-service digital agency and Google Partner, hosted a Digital Media Expo 2016 with the University of Houston – Victoria’s Small Business
meta.html_title: Highlights from Advocate Digital Media & UHV SBDC’S Digital Media Expo 2016
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Advocate Digital Media, a full-service digital agency and Google Partner, hosted a Digital Media Expo 2016 with the University of Houston – Victoria’s Small Business Development Center on Thursday, March 3. The event was well attended by business owners looking to learn more about digital marketing in 2016. 

“Business owners have to learn how to engage with consumers on their terms and where the customers are spending their time [on their phones, tablets, computers, etc]. At our event, attendees learned how to plan and budget to reach this shifting audience,” said Jason Holmes, ADM’s general manager. 

Many of the panels and discussions focused on different aspects of digital marketing from the role it plays in everyday life to tools that help see how effective your digital marketing strategy is.

The lunch panel discussion sponsored by The UPS Store focused solely on content marketing. Content marketing is the key to reaching consumers in a world where they are used to blocking, fast forwarding and tuning out the traditional advertising around them. Panelists included Holmes; Jennifer Love, digital sales director at ADM; Rebekah Steen, ADM’s lead fulfillment specialist; and Dr. Jun Yang, UHV’s associate professor of marketing.  

 

The following are a few key points from several of the presentations:

 

  • The Internet of things—today’s reality
    • You cannot do what you’ve always done, that world is over and gone.
    • $15 million was spent in digital advertising in the Crossroads in 2015 per market research by Borrell and Associates.
    • 2016 will be the year more is spent on online advertising than offline
  • Mobile strategy
    • 64% of American adults are smartphone owners
    • Consumer journey is now fragmented into micro-moments, which are key—be there when they reach for their devices
    • People search more on Google on their phone than their desktop
    • Use a responsive website for better Google rankings and consumer experience
    • Social advertising, streaming music and video—be present where the consumers are spending their time online
    • AdWords can geo-target, use keywords and context

       

  • Marketing Plan
    • First, you must know your business – your image, key messages, experience, consistency/trust and your audience.
    • Know the 4Ps of Marketing – Product, Pricing, Placement, Promotion
    • Study the various promotional channels – branding, offline, online, public relations and develop a multifaceted approach to reach and connect with various audiences to deliver your message.
    • Determine your marketing expenses to develop your budget. Include all paid media, collateral materials, online expense, public relations, trade shows, etc.
    • Without a budget, you cannot implement a marketing plan.

       

  • Engaging Social Media
    • 87% of small businesses use social media marketing
    • Which social channels are right for your business? Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Pinterest, Instagram and Google+ are the main channels and managing requires time and investment in learning each platform.
    • What do I say? Entertain, invite conversation, ask questions, share video and images. Be informative – share tips and content that matters to the audience. Share calls to action, but not a “buy now” voice.

       

  • Native advertising/content marketing
    • Local and traditional organizations are using this as a way to get your message out to people who are growing resistant to traditional marketing mediums
    • One of the only ways to connect to cord cutters and ad blind
    • Content trends include listicles, videos and memes

       

  • Google Analytics
    • Free service offered by Google with detailed statistics about who visits your website
    • Easy to implement and use, analyze online and offline ad efforts, improve efforts with data you gather

       

  • Determining the best budget for your digital strategy
    • Can you fund digital on top of what your current marketing budget is?
    • If not, where can you afford to shift funds from in your budget to digital. Eliminate budget waste and examine everything you’ve been buying.
    • Create a new plan and start with digital. It can’t be an afterthought in 2016.

    • Can you fund digital on top of what your current marketing budget is?
    • If not, where can you afford to shift funds from in your budget to digital. Eliminate budget waste and examine everything you’ve been buying.
    • Create a new plan and start with digital. It can’t be an afterthought in 2016.

ADM was recognized in the following areas:

Booming Port Lavaca Website—Silver ADDY Award

Responsive Website - http://www.boomingportlavaca.com

User Experience

 

Grog Bar Logo—Silver ADDY Award

Logo Design

 

Innovative Interiors—Bronze ADDY Award

Email Design

“We were honored to be recognized for our creative work, especially in the area of digital marketing. At ADM, we enjoy collaborating with our clients to create engaging experiences online, as well as in traditional media channels,” said Jason Holmes, ADM general manager.

meta.post_summary: Advocate Digital Media, a full-service digital agency and Google Partner located in Victoria, Texas, will be recognized at the 2016 American Advertising ADDY Awards in five areas as well as four individual awards.
meta.html_title: Advocate Digital Set to Win Multiple Awards at 2016 American Advertisings Awards – Corpus Christi
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Advocate Digital Media, a full-service digital agency and Google Partner located in Victoria, Texas, will be recognized at the 2016 American Advertising ADDY Awards in five areas as well as four individual awards. 

ADM will be recognized in the areas of Website User Experience, Consumer Websites, Website Responsive Design, Logo Design and Email Design. 

Some of the sites that will be recognized are: http://www.boomingportlavaca.com, http://www.organicemporiumllc.com and http://www.visitlongviewtexas.com. 

Advocate Digital Media staff members were nominated for the following ADDY Big Wigs awards: Best Media Buyer Nominee: Emily Weatherly, Best Social Media Manager Nominee: Amanda Bowlby, Best Website Developer Nominee: Joshua Tesch, Best Digital Ad Producer Nominee: Nancy Bennett. 

Big Wig nominees were nominated by their peers in January as they consider them to be the best of the best in the advertising industry. Voting for the Big Wigs awards isnow open and ends on February 19. Big Wigs voting is open to anyone and you are not required to vote in all of the categories. For more rules and to vote, go to this link: http://www.aafcc.club/big-wig-nominations 

The awards ceremony will be held Friday Feb. 26, when ADM will find out what place they received in the five categories as well as any Big Wig award winners.  

Big Wig winners will be invited to participate in a wig fashion show to benefit their charity of choice in Spring 2016.

objects.author: deepti@thewebplant.com
objects.html_title: Ways to Reach Consumers in 2016
objects.label: Ways to Reach Consumers in 2016

meta.post_summary: Imagine, if you will, a typical morning routine. You come into the office enjoying your cup of coffee preparing for the day ahead. It’s still early and you’re not quite ready to start on that big project just yet, so you turn on your favorite Pandora music. Just to make sure you haven’t missed anything a friend has posted, you check Facebook. Being a concerned citizen, you take a look at the local newspaper website and catch up on current events.
meta.html_title: Ways to Reach Consumers in 2016
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Imagine, if you will, a typical morning routine. You come into the office enjoying your cup of coffee preparing for the day ahead. It’s still early and you’re not quite ready to start on that big project just yet, so you turn on your favorite Pandora music. Just to make sure you haven’t missed anything a friend has posted, you check Facebook. Being a concerned citizen, you take a look at the local newspaper website and catch up on current events. 

Small and large businesses alike are facing the challenge of how to reach their customers in 2016. In today’s fast paced world you have to get more creative to reach your customers and make your adverting dollars work for you.

Digital advertising is constantly evolving and replacing traditional media’s effectiveness with today’s consumer. If you aren’t allocating your marketing budget to the methods listed below, you are missing out on potential customers.

 

Mobile

With consumers using their smartphones to access information more than ever before, the importance of mobile optimized sites and mobile ads cannot be stressed enough. It should be no surprise that Google announced mobile traffic finally topped desktop traffic in 10 different countries in 2015.

 

Social Media

The social media landscape has changed how everyone uses the Internet. Facebook is now used as a search engine and marketplace. Facebook and other social media platforms are a way for advertisers to reach their customers on a personal level by identifying their wants, needs and likes and conveniently placing them in their feeds. Businesses are also using social media to truly connect with their customers, allowing customers more access and transparency into their businesses than ever before.

 

Video

While video ads aren’t a new concept, the number of ways they can reach an audience is larger than ever. YouTube has raised the bar, encouraging other large platforms to offer more options for their customers to take in advertising. The numbers of those who like, share and watch video ads are increasing all the time in comparison to traditional advertising.

 

Streaming Services

Streaming services have forever changed the way that we take in music and television shows. Services like Pandora and Hulu are giving mobility with when and where they consume media. These platforms offer limited commercials which means the ones that are shown have more of an impact.

 

Geo Targeting

What if you could serve ads to your customers because they have entered your store or location, or better yet, because they have visited a competitor’s location? Advertisers are using this technology to not only target current customers, but to reach out to potential customers based on their shopping habits and places they have frequented. The possibilities with this technology are limitless and will be the fastest-growing service in 2016.

All of this may seem overwhelming and have you asking yourself, “Where do I even start?” The answer is easy. Let Advocate Digital Media do all the legwork for you. 

Our sales and fulfillment teams can sit down with you and help come up with the perfect mix of marketing and advertising services that make sense to your business and to help you reach your customers effectively. We work with all types of business and all types of budgets. Don’t let you business fall behind the curve and continue missing out on potential customers, give us a call today.

Just to make sure you haven’t missed anything a friend has posted, you check Facebook. Being a concerned citizen, you take a look at the local newspaper website and catch up on current events.

Imagine, if you will, a typical morning routine. You come into the office enjoying your cup of coffee preparing for the day ahead. It’s still early and you’re not quite ready to start on that big project just yet, so you turn on your favorite Pandora music. Just to make sure you haven’t missed anything a friend has posted, you check Facebook. Being a concerned citizen, you take a look at the local newspaper website and catch up on current events. 

Small and large businesses alike are facing the challenge of how to reach their customers in 2016. In today’s fast paced world you have to get more creative to reach your customers and make your adverting dollars work for you.

Digital advertising is constantly evolving and replacing traditional media’s effectiveness with today’s consumer. If you aren’t allocating your marketing budget to the methods listed below, you are missing out on potential customers.

 

Mobile

With consumers using their smartphones to access information more than ever before, the importance of mobile optimized sites and mobile ads cannot be stressed enough. It should be no surprise that Google announced mobile traffic finally topped desktop traffic in 10 different countries in 2015.

 

Social Media

The social media landscape has changed how everyone uses the Internet. Facebook is now used as a search engine and marketplace. Facebook and other social media platforms are a way for advertisers to reach their customers on a personal level by identifying their wants, needs and likes and conveniently placing them in their feeds. Businesses are also using social media to truly connect with their customers, allowing customers more access and transparency into their businesses than ever before.

 

Video

While video ads aren’t a new concept, the number of ways they can reach an audience is larger than ever. YouTube has raised the bar, encouraging other large platforms to offer more options for their customers to take in advertising. The numbers of those who like, share and watch video ads are increasing all the time in comparison to traditional advertising.

 

Streaming Services

Streaming services have forever changed the way that we take in music and television shows. Services like Pandora and Hulu are giving mobility with when and where they consume media. These platforms offer limited commercials which means the ones that are shown have more of an impact.

 

Geo Targeting

What if you could serve ads to your customers because they have entered your store or location, or better yet, because they have visited a competitor’s location? Advertisers are using this technology to not only target current customers, but to reach out to potential customers based on their shopping habits and places they have frequented. The possibilities with this technology are limitless and will be the fastest-growing service in 2016.

All of this may seem overwhelming and have you asking yourself, “Where do I even start?” The answer is easy. Let Advocate Digital Media do all the legwork for you. 

Our sales and fulfillment teams can sit down with you and help come up with the perfect mix of marketing and advertising services that make sense to your business and to help you reach your customers effectively. We work with all types of business and all types of budgets. Don’t let you business fall behind the curve and continue missing out on potential customers, give us a call today.

objects.title: Ways to Reach Consumers in 2016

objects.label: Make your social media work for you

meta.post_summary: Ignoring the elephant in the room is no longer an option: whether you like it or not, people are talking about your business online. If
meta.html_title: Make your social media work for you
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Ignoring the elephant in the room is no longer an option: whether you like it or not, people are talking about your business online. If you do not become engaged in the conversation, you risk not only losing valuable customers, but missing out on potential customers.

Brand management is more important than ever in a society accustomed to having information readily available in the palm of their hand.

Keeping up with what people are saying about your brand is more now than the typical search engine optimized strategies and is moving increasingly into social media. Social media platforms provide an unprecedented opportunity for businesses to cultivate personal relationships with clientele.

Navigating social media platforms can be an intimidating task for any business owner, but with some knowledge and effort it can become a valuable part of the marketing plan.

Creating a schedule for the week or month of what you plan to post and when will keep you organized and purposeful in your social media posts. Update frequently with high quality information relevant to your brand to keep consumers engaged.

Social media posts are an elusive balance of quality and quantity; when this equation is unbalanced, the user may become annoyed and quit following your page.

Posts should be to the point while providing value to the consumer. The best posts also give consumers a reason to positively interact with your brand.

Social media websites, especially Facebook, are constantly changing their algorithms affecting the best practices of running an account. A simple way to make sure your business is performing it’s best online is to let the social media experts at Advocate Digital Media manage your accounts for you! Contact your salesperson for more information today.

objects.html_title: Navigating Social Media Platforms
objects.label: Navigating Social Media Platforms

meta.post_summary: Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and Pinterest are the main social media platforms businesses use to increase prominence online.
meta.html_title: Navigating Social Media Platforms
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and Pinterest are the main social media platforms businesses use to increase prominence online.

However, not every platform is an appropriate avenue for every business to employ. While Pinterest and Instagram work great for clothing boutique, they may not be a great fit for a counseling service.

The biggest mistake business owners make is creating a profile on every social media platform available and then not keeping up with it. When a consumer comes across a Facebook page that has not been updated in over a year, or even in a couple of months, it subconsciously decreases the brand value in the user’s mind.

Keeping social media platforms up to date is exceptionally important. And social media platforms that create direct value to your business are imperative to the success of your campaign. Each platform has a different formula for success, including the way the post is constructed and the time of day the post goes live.

Facebook and Twitter provide some analytics with the best time of day to post, an overview of your followers, and what posts performed the best. This information is crucial in measuring the success of your social media campaigns. Each page on social media is unique and performs completely different due to the audience that is interacting with the page on a daily basis.

The most important aspect of using social media for your business is to create a personal relationship with the community, not pitching a service or product. Become part of the conversation. See how one business did this effectively with our Booming Port Lavaca case study.

{{cta('1a0c8da0-0405-4e0b-bb96-6e187f8b0221')}}

Social media platforms are constantly evolving. While it is important to understand the way each page works, true success will come from trial and error while relying on your statistics to give feedback for your unique audience.

objects.html_title: Advocate Digital Media Moves to CivilCorp Plaza
objects.label: Advocate Digital Media Moves to CivilCorp Plaza

meta.post_summary: Advocate Digital Media, a full-service digital agency and Google Partner, has made a significant move into a new office space on the second floor of
meta.html_title: Advocate Digital Media Moves to CivilCorp Plaza
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Advocate Digital Media, a full-service digital agency and Google Partner, has made a significant move into a new office space on the second floor of the CivilCorp Plaza, located at 4611 E. Airline Road in Victoria.

The move was necessary to focus on the needs of the growing ADM team and incorporate a progressive and more collaborative workspace. It also allows the creative agency to stand apart in the Crossroads. 

“This move has been in the works for quite some time. Our entire Victoria team has been involved in the process, especially in the selection of where we wanted to move, given our vision to set a new standard in the creative community. This move is a continuation of our shift in the past two years to a full-service digital advertising agency, “ said Jason Holmes, general manager of ADM. 

Location was one of the key determining factors in selecting CivilCorp Plaza. 

“We sought out a space in a developing area of Victoria. Given the location close to Victoria’s transportation infrastructure - Loop 463, John Stockbauer and Houston Highway - our team can quickly access our clients’ businesses and vice versa. We are thrilled to have a space to host creative consultations with our growing client base,” Holmes said. 

The new space has a modern layout with clean lines, using glass and a contemporary color scheme. One of the most notable highlights is the open workspace where the developers, fulfillment and creative teams will be housed. The space will support collaboration between our production team in new and exciting ways. With large windows overlooking the Colony Creek Country Club golf course, the copious amount of natural light pouring into the space will be a welcomed change of scenery.

Advocate Digital Media will be hosting a ribbon cutting and business after hours event in conjunction with the Victoria Chamber of Commerce on Thursday, April 14 to offer tours to the business community as well as an opportunity to meet the full team. The ribbon cutting will be held at 4:30 p.m. with the business after hours immediately following. Those wishing to attend are encouraged to rsvp to info@advocatedigital.com.

Our entire Victoria team has been involved in the process, especially in the selection of where we wanted to move, given our vision to set a new standard in the creative community. This move is a continuation of our shift in the past two years to a full-service digital advertising agency, “ said Jason Holmes, general manager of ADM. 

Location was one of the key determining factors in selecting CivilCorp Plaza. 

“We sought out a space in a developing area of Victoria. Given the location close to Victoria’s transportation infrastructure - Loop 463, John Stockbauer and Houston Highway - our team can quickly access our clients’ businesses and vice versa. We are thrilled to have a space to host creative consultations with our growing client base,” Holmes said. 

The new space has a modern layout with clean lines, using glass and a contemporary color scheme. One of the most notable highlights is the open workspace where the developers, fulfillment and creative teams will be housed. The space will support collaboration between our production team in new and exciting ways. With large windows overlooking the Colony Creek Country Club golf course, the copious amount of natural light pouring into the space will be a welcomed change of scenery.

Advocate Digital Media will be hosting a ribbon cutting and business after hours event in conjunction with the Victoria Chamber of Commerce on Thursday, April 14 to offer tours to the business community as well as an opportunity to meet the full team. The ribbon cutting will be held at 4:30 p.m. with the business after hours immediately following. Those wishing to attend are encouraged to rsvp to info@advocatedigital.com.

objects.html_title: Advocate Digital Media & UHV SBDC Present Digital Media Expo 2016
objects.label: Advocate Digital Media & UHV SBDC Present Digital Media Expo 2016

meta.post_summary: Business owners will have an opportunity to learn more about digital marketing in today’s economy at an expo hosted by the University of Houston-Victoria Small
meta.html_title: Advocate Digital Media & UHV SBDC Present Digital Media Expo 2016
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Business owners will have an opportunity to learn more about digital marketing in today’s economy at an expo hosted by the University of Houston-Victoria Small Business Development Center and Advocate Digital Media. 

“Digital marketing encompasses so much in today’s world,” UHV SBDC Director Joe Humphreys said. “People have begun to use the Internet and digital resources as their primary sources of information. Business people recognize the web and digital media are becoming some of the main channels to reach customers and grow their business.” 

The Digital Media Expo 2016 will be from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. March 3 at UHV University North, 3007 N. Ben Wilson St. There also will be a lunch panel discussion. 

Advocate Digital Media is a full-service digital agency and Google Partner. 

“Now, more than ever, business owners have to learn how to engage with consumers on their terms and where the customers are spending their time, such as on their phones, tablets and computers,” ADM General Manager Jason Holmes said. “At our event, they will learn how to plan and budget to reach this shifting audience.” 

Many of the panels and discussions will focus on different aspects of digital marketing from the role it plays in everyday life to tools that evaluate the effectiveness of digital marketing strategies. One presentation that will be of interest to many small business owners is Budgeting for Digital and 2016 Digital Projections, which will be presented by Holmes. 

“This is a question we often are asked by business owners who have not budgeted for digital in the past,” Holmes said. “They are not sure how much to allocate to it and where exactly to spend it since there are many ways to market a business online.” 

The lunch panel discussion, sponsored by The UPS Store, will focus on content marketing. Content marketing is the key to reaching consumers in a world where they are used to blocking, fast forwarding and tuning out the traditional advertising around them. Panelists include Holmes; Jennifer Love, ADM digital sales director; Rebekah Steen, ADM’s lead fulfillment specialist; and Jun Yang, a UHV associate professor of marketing. Humphreys will be the panel moderator. 

“In today’s fast-paced, information-rich society, businesses need to constantly work to keep up with relevant marketing strategies,” said Farhang Niroomand, dean of the UHV School of Business Administration. “This expo will help equip area business owners for success. The UHV SBDC is proud to partner with Advocate Digital Media to offer this event to the community.” 

Other topics covered include mobile strategy, marketing plan creation, engaging social media and using Google Analytics. Tickets for DMX are $45 in advance or $60 at the door and can be purchased at dmxexpo2016.eventzilla.net.

objects.html_title: Why People Respond More to Video Than Text
objects.label: Why People Respond More to Video Than Text

meta.post_summary: We’ve all heard the saying “a picture is worth a thousand words” but how much is a video worth? It must be more than a
meta.html_title: Why People Respond More to Video Than Text
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
We’ve all heard the saying “a picture is worth a thousand words” but how much is a video worth? It must be more than a picture and certainly more than plain text. 

Consumers today are more likely to share, comment and like an online video than a simple text article. Yet, studies show only a little more than half of companies are making use of videos in their marketing and advertising. 

Video drives a higher rate of engagement for many reasons. Commonly, the video was humorous and they wanted others to have a good laugh or the video sparked controversy. Some even say they shared the video because they found it outrageous or extremely bad. 

Video views have skyrocketed and are projected to continue growing in years to come. YouTube estimates that 300 hours of video content is uploaded to its platform every minute, generating billions of views each day. 

Video offers new opportunities for marketers like never before. The days of blanket advertising to reach a single audience are behind us. With social channels like Facebook and Twitter offering video advertising, marketers have unprecedented ability to specifically target consumers based on demographic, behavior, preference and more. 

The rise of YouTube and decline of traditional publishing emphasizes how much more interested we have become in visual information. It’s easy to see why YouTube receives more than one billion unique visitors every month, more than any other website apart from Facebook. 

Video conveys a more powerful message because of how we process information. A well-produced video can put you where you are not only going to be found but it will also help you make an impactful message. 

With the average attention span at about 8 seconds, businesses no longer need a lot of money for one big budget production. They can spend smaller amounts on short-form videos that speak specifically to a custom audience. Those that can leverage the content will have an edge on the competition. 

Here at Advocate Digital Media, we can work with you to create the type of video you want to represent your company. Talk to your sales representative today.

 

Some of the Best Advertising in 2015

Android: Friends Furever

987,361 Shares

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vnVuqfXohxc 

 

The Collective Project: Robert Downey Jr. Delivers Bionic Arm

2,079,279 Shares

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oEx5lmbCKtY 

 

Purina: Puppyhood

2,888,879 Shares

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L3MtFGWRXAA

objects.author: deepti@thewebplant.com
objects.html_title: Have You Swallowed The Red Pill?
objects.label: Have You Swallowed The Red Pill?

meta.post_summary: In the classic sci-fi movie The Matrix, the main character Neo is given a choice that sets up the whole movie: swallow the Red Pill
meta.html_title: Have You Swallowed The Red Pill?
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
In the classic sci-fi movie The Matrix, the main character Neo is given a choice that sets up the whole movie: swallow the Red Pill and see the world for what it is or take the Blue Pill and continue to live in ignorance, seeing the world as he has always believe it existed. You probably remember or can guess the outcome. Our hero chooses the Red Pill, and it’s a painful choice.

So how can this movie scene possibly relate to marketing? If you think of our digital culture as the way the world really is and the traditional media landscape as the “Blue Pill” world you thought you knew, then this analogy fits well. Just imagine how painful it can be for a business owner with a limited marketing budget to “wake up” and realize their expensive, traditional advertising spend isn’t as effective as it used to be while further learning they aren’t reaching anyone in the digital culture. Not as bad as waking to the post apocalyptic existence faced by Neo, but an expensive dream nonetheless.

Now I can hear some of you saying “well that might be true for ‘Techies’ that watch The Matrix but…” To which I say, the lowly banner ad is 21 years old. The Matrix is nearly 17 years old. If Google were a person it would be old enough vote in the next presidential election! The digital culture is no longer new. In fact, the digital culture is mainstream and ubiquitous.

Look around your stores. People are on their phones, shopping for the very products you carry, right on your showroom floor. Do you not think they’re doing the same thing at home on their tablet or phone?

We live in a time of unprecedented disruption.

§ Digital publishing, tablets and phones have disrupted newspapers and magazines.

§ Over the air radio has been disrupted by satellite and more dramatically Internet radio alternatives like Pandora, Spotify and Apple Radio.

§ Broadcast TV is at the precipice of a massive disruption as streaming devices like Roku, Apple TV and Chromecast, along with accompanying content services like Hulu, Netflix and Amazon are now squarely in the mainstream. Even market leaders such as ESPN are bracing for massive layoffs as consumers rapidly unplug from pay TV and skip through commercials on their favorite primetime shows.

The question you need to ask yourself as a local marketer is this: “Do I want to continue to see the world as it was or as it really is?” There’s really only one answer. If you want to attract new business and add new customers you must embrace change and in a big way. Time to take the Red Pill.

objects.html_title: Cuero Pecan House launches new e-commerce website
objects.label: Cuero Pecan House launches new e-commerce website

meta.post_summary: Cuero Pecan House has launched a completely redesigned website, www.cueropecanhouse.com. It was unveiled early October, increasing the ease in which online shoppers can view homemade treats and gourmet items and purchase online.
meta.html_title: Cuero Pecan House launches new e-commerce website
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Cuero Pecan House has launched a completely redesigned website, www.cueropecanhouse.com. It was unveiled early October, increasing the ease in which online shoppers can view homemade treats and gourmet items and purchase online. 

“The creation of the new website was a labor of love for our valued customers. We poured over the details and feel the end product is one that our customers will enjoy browsing and discovering our array of local products. With the holidays right around the corner, our customers can shop with ease and even ship local eats and treats to share with their loved ones,” Annette Rath, Co-Owner of Cuero Pecan House said. 

One of the biggest improvements to the site was a reorganization of the vast amount of products available on the website. Now things like recipes, the Nutrageous newsletter, corporate order information, gift boxes and information on items only available in store are more accessible and organized than they were before.

Cuero Pecan House partnered with Advocate Digital Media on the design, implementation and management of the new site. Featuring responsive design, customers can access the site easily on any platform – desktop, laptop, tablet or smartphone. 

“No matter how you are coming to the site – whether looking at your desktop or on your mobile phone - the site has the latest features,” Erwin Rath, Co-Owner of Cuero Pecan House said. 

The site also integrates social platforms like Facebook to encourage engagement with their Pecan House fans.

Advocate Digital Media’s full service agency has developed to be the area’s primary source for digital marketing solutions, attracting a diverse list of clients in South Texas, and is a leader in developing business-centered web sites.

objects.author: deepti@thewebplant.com
objects.html_title: Marketing Just Happens to Be Digital
objects.label: Marketing Just Happens to Be Digital

meta.post_summary: “There is no such thing as digital marketing. There is marketing – most of which happens to be digital.”
meta.html_title: Marketing Just Happens to Be Digital
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
“There is no such thing as digital marketing. There is marketing – most of which happens to be digital.”

That was part of the message Brad Jakeman, PepsiCo’s global beverage president, delivered to the audience attending the “Masters of Marketing” conference in Orlando last week.

He went on to say, “Disruption has happened around us and we’re still talking about 30-second television ads. We fundamentally haven’t changed.”

These comments from a key executive at such a brand-focused company are disconcerting.  Also disconcerting is the fact most of the conference attendees work in agencies that still focus on the 30-second spot and rely on the supposed reach of broadcast TV.

Mr. Jakeman went on to disparage terminology used in the marketing world. He said key concepts like “Agency” and even “Advertising” are keeping brands locked in the past.

In his view, the very concept of advertising is nothing more than “polluting content” with a disruptive ad.

True, the scale involved in marketing a product like Pepsi is very different from that of a local business, but the fundamental challenges are similar. Today, consumers can choose to ignore brands and advertising messages like never before.

Until they need you, they don’t want to hear from you as a brand and really don’t care about your products or services. But when they need you, they expect you to be accessible and ubiquitous. You have to own your business category where consumers live and they increasingly live a digital lifestyle.

This is why national brands are spending so much money on digital marketing, or marketing that “just happens to be digital.”

The digital culture that has taken over our society since the proliferation of smart phones and tablets. Since the 2009 release of the iPhone 3GS – the first iPhone that supported an acceptable Internet experience – the world has changed and advertising budgets have shifted in response.

In 2009, digital advertising spend accounted for just 18.4% of all local advertising dollars in the Victoria market and 16.2% in the Longview market. According to Borrell Associates, our best source for local advertising forecasts, digital advertising will make up about 47% of all advertising spending in Victoria Texas and 42.9% in Longview in 2016!

Not surprisingly, more than half of that spend is coming from big brands reaching into the market and building their customer base, many times at the expense of local businesses.

So if you’re a business owner or in charge of marketing a local business have you allowed this disruption to just “happen around you”? Or have you drastically changed your approach in meaningful ways?

“There is no such thing as digital marketing. There is marketing – most of which happens to be digital.”

That was part of the message Brad Jakeman, PepsiCo’s global beverage president, delivered to the audience attending the “Masters of Marketing” conference in Orlando last week.

He went on to say, “Disruption has happened around us and we’re still talking about 30-second television ads. We fundamentally haven’t changed.”

These comments from a key executive at such a brand-focused company are disconcerting.  Also disconcerting is the fact most of the conference attendees work in agencies that still focus on the 30-second spot and rely on the supposed reach of broadcast TV.

Mr. Jakeman went on to disparage terminology used in the marketing world. He said key concepts like “Agency” and even “Advertising” are keeping brands locked in the past.

In his view, the very concept of advertising is nothing more than “polluting content” with a disruptive ad.

True, the scale involved in marketing a product like Pepsi is very different from that of a local business, but the fundamental challenges are similar. Today, consumers can choose to ignore brands and advertising messages like never before.

Until they need you, they don’t want to hear from you as a brand and really don’t care about your products or services. But when they need you, they expect you to be accessible and ubiquitous. You have to own your business category where consumers live and they increasingly live a digital lifestyle.

This is why national brands are spending so much money on digital marketing, or marketing that “just happens to be digital.”

The digital culture that has taken over our society since the proliferation of smart phones and tablets. Since the 2009 release of the iPhone 3GS – the first iPhone that supported an acceptable Internet experience – the world has changed and advertising budgets have shifted in response.

In 2009, digital advertising spend accounted for just 18.4% of all local advertising dollars in the Victoria market and 16.2% in the Longview market. According to Borrell Associates, our best source for local advertising forecasts, digital advertising will make up about 47% of all advertising spending in Victoria Texas and 42.9% in Longview in 2016!

Not surprisingly, more than half of that spend is coming from big brands reaching into the market and building their customer base, many times at the expense of local businesses.

So if you’re a business owner or in charge of marketing a local business have you allowed this disruption to just “happen around you”? Or have you drastically changed your approach in meaningful ways?

objects.html_title: See Advocate Digital Media at the Internship and Career Fair
objects.label: See Advocate Digital Media at the Internship and Career Fair

meta.post_summary: Advocate Digital Media (ADM), a full-service digital advertising agency and Google Partner, will be recruiting at the free Internship and Career Fair on Thursday, October 8 at the Hilton Garden Inn from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m.
meta.html_title: See Advocate Digital Media at the Internship and Career Fair
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Advocate Digital Media (ADM), a full-service digital advertising agency and Google Partner, will be recruiting at the free Internship and Career Fair on Thursday, October 8 at the Hilton Garden Inn from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. 

Those seeking a career in a fast-paced marketing and advertising agency are invited to visit with the ADM team to discuss current openings and even internship opportunities. 

Current openings at Advocate Digital Media include positions for account executives, as well as web developer and internship opportunities. Learn more about the ADM team and the openings at http://www.advocatedigitalmedia.com/about/ 

“Our culture at Advocate Digital Media is one of respect for our colleagues, as well as a fun and challenging environment. We are looking for motivated sales consultants with professional demeanor that are detail oriented and most importantly, passionate about sales and wanting to help businesses succeed, “ said Jennifer Love, sales director for Advocate Digital Media. 

Love said the ideal account executive would have a background in business, marketing, sales and communications as well as experience in online media or similar field. 

Those wishing to attend the Career Fair on October 8 are invited to visit ADM’s website to learn more about the openings and encouraged to submit their application in advance of the event. 

 

Advocate Digital Media is a full service digital advertising agency and Google partner offering targeted digital campaigns, responsive website design and optimization, industry leading search engine strategies and social media plans for a variety of clients. The agency handles all forms of advertising and marketing, including branding, creative design, video production, outdoor, online, TV, radio, and print media planning and buying. Learn more at www.AdvocateDigitalMedia.com

objects.html_title: Advocate Digital Media Hosts Google Partner Event
objects.label: Advocate Digital Media Hosts Google Partner Event

meta.post_summary: Advocate Digital Media, a full service digital agency and Google Partner, will host a Google Partner Connect event presented by Google experts on Thursday, October 8 during the lunch hour at The Club in Colony Creek in Victoria, TX. Those business owners wishing to attend this educational event and benefit are asked to RSVP to 361-580-6319 or email info@advocatedigital.com.
meta.html_title: Advocate Digital Media Hosts Google Partner Event
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Advocate Digital Media, a full service digital agency and Google Partner, will host a Google Partner Connect event presented by Google experts on Thursday, October 8 during the lunch hour at The Club in Colony Creek in Victoria, TX. Those business owners wishing to attend this educational event and benefit are asked to RSVP to 361-580-6319 or email info@advocatedigital.com. 

Presenters include Fred Vallaeys, a Google AdWords evangelist and Matt Lawson. Vallaeys will discuss how small businesses can better navigate the web and expand their online presence through smarter customer insights. Lawson will present the “micro-moments” that guide a customer’s decision journey and how businesses can use online marketing to reach potential customers during the moments that matter most.

“This is a great opportunity for local business owners to stay ahead of the curve and hear about emerging trends directly from national Google Partners as well as Advocate Digital Media’s local Google Partner experts, “ said Jason Holmes, general manager for Advocate Digital Media. Being a certified Google Partner means that Google trusts Advocate Digital Media, who has demonstrated proven success using industry best practices to provide high quality digital marketing services. 

Those wishing to attend the Google Partner Connect event on are asked to RSVP no later than Wednesday afternoon by noon by calling 361-580-6319 or email info@advocatedigital.com.

objects.author: deepti@thewebplant.com
objects.html_title: GEICO’s “Unskippable” Campaign and the effectiveness of preroll video
objects.label: GEICO’s “Unskippable” Campaign and the effectiveness of preroll video

meta.post_summary: Quick, think for a moment about that catchy commercial that’s stuck in your head every so often. What made it stick in your head? Was there a compelling piece of music? A lengthy, flashy presentation? A great storyline that was told over the course of two minutes?
meta.html_title: GEICO’s “Unskippable” Campaign and the effectiveness of preroll video
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Quick, think for a moment about that catchy commercial that’s stuck in your head every so often. What made it stick in your head? Was there a compelling piece of music? A lengthy, flashy presentation? A great storyline that was told over the course of two minutes? 

Most likely not. What likely caught your attention was a great piece of creative work that paid off its climax within five seconds or less. 

In a world with more and more video demand, it’s not just important to get a great commercial. In fact, it’s most important to get the attention of a viewer quickly and keep that viewer engaged with a simple message. 

Let me try to illustrate how important this is from a personal perspective: When I tell people what I do for a living, the first thing I hear from friends, family and neighbors on the street is “Oh, you make those annoying videos that come up before the thing I want.” 

And that’s true. No one purposely gets on the Internet to watch commercials. Yet, according to Insivia, video is a superior way of getting a message to consumers - in fact, 95% of a message when they watch it in a video, compared to 10% when reading text. 

This is why it is critical to get a catchy connection to your audience within the first five seconds! 

This is why GEICO’s “Unskippable” campaign is rapidly becoming one of the most effective viral pre-roll campaigns in recent times. The primary focus of the campaign is that the ads are so quickly over, that the message is, in fact, not skippable. 

In every ad, whether it be businessmen meeting in an elevator or a cleaning crew cleaning an office, the main joke and tagline of “Savings!” is uttered within the first five seconds of the video. 

One of the most popular videos (and arguably my personal favorite) is the “High Five” video, with more than 17.6 million views on GEICO’s official YouTube page - certainly worthy of being called a “viral success.” 

But here, the ad shows off how effective the entire video campaign is. The payoff comes quick, with the two friends shouting “Savings!” and jumping for a high-five within three seconds. Their comedic pause immediately after surprises the viewer enough to see the GEICO logo pop up and hear to the sales pitch, including GEICO’s famous “15 minutes/15 percent” slogan. 

Within five seconds, GEICO has established the perfect pre-roll, something with humor, effective reach and a strong brand message - exactly what a consumer will allow without feeling frustrated before watching their favorite music video or streaming their favorite TV show. 

When done well, such as the videos in this GEICO campaign, pre-roll ads are an effective way to reach new clients and customers. 

According to Reel SEO and the Online Publishers Association, 80% of internet users recall watching a video ad in the past thirty days and 46% of users took action on the video advertisement. 

Additionally, 26% looked for more information about the subject of the ad, 22% visited the website named in the ad and 12% actually purchased the product featured in the ad! 

That’s a lot of business for a campaign that’s getting tons of viral digital video looks. 

Let us help you craft your next digital video campaign, and give you innovative creative services that will bring more business to your company.

Additionally, 26% looked for more information about the subject of the ad, 22% visited the website named in the ad and 12% actually purchased the product featured in the ad! 

That’s a lot of business for a campaign that’s getting tons of viral digital video looks.

parent_blog.label: Digital Trends
parent_blog.name: Digital Trends

objects.post_body:
Quick, think for a moment about that catchy commercial that’s stuck in your head every so often. What made it stick in your head? Was there a compelling piece of music? A lengthy, flashy presentation? A great storyline that was told over the course of two minutes? 

Most likely not. What likely caught your attention was a great piece of creative work that paid off its climax within five seconds or less. 

In a world with more and more video demand, it’s not just important to get a great commercial. In fact, it’s most important to get the attention of a viewer quickly and keep that viewer engaged with a simple message. 

Let me try to illustrate how important this is from a personal perspective: When I tell people what I do for a living, the first thing I hear from friends, family and neighbors on the street is “Oh, you make those annoying videos that come up before the thing I want.” 

And that’s true. No one purposely gets on the Internet to watch commercials. Yet, according to Insivia, video is a superior way of getting a message to consumers - in fact, 95% of a message when they watch it in a video, compared to 10% when reading text. 

This is why it is critical to get a catchy connection to your audience within the first five seconds! 

This is why GEICO’s “Unskippable” campaign is rapidly becoming one of the most effective viral pre-roll campaigns in recent times. The primary focus of the campaign is that the ads are so quickly over, that the message is, in fact, not skippable. 

In every ad, whether it be businessmen meeting in an elevator or a cleaning crew cleaning an office, the main joke and tagline of “Savings!” is uttered within the first five seconds of the video. 

One of the most popular videos (and arguably my personal favorite) is the “High Five” video, with more than 17.6 million views on GEICO’s official YouTube page - certainly worthy of being called a “viral success.” 

But here, the ad shows off how effective the entire video campaign is. The payoff comes quick, with the two friends shouting “Savings!” and jumping for a high-five within three seconds. Their comedic pause immediately after surprises the viewer enough to see the GEICO logo pop up and hear to the sales pitch, including GEICO’s famous “15 minutes/15 percent” slogan. 

Within five seconds, GEICO has established the perfect pre-roll, something with humor, effective reach and a strong brand message - exactly what a consumer will allow without feeling frustrated before watching their favorite music video or streaming their favorite TV show. 

When done well, such as the videos in this GEICO campaign, pre-roll ads are an effective way to reach new clients and customers. 

According to Reel SEO and the Online Publishers Association, 80% of internet users recall watching a video ad in the past thirty days and 46% of users took action on the video advertisement. 

Additionally, 26% looked for more information about the subject of the ad, 22% visited the website named in the ad and 12% actually purchased the product featured in the ad! 

That’s a lot of business for a campaign that’s getting tons of viral digital video looks. 

Let us help you craft your next digital video campaign, and give you innovative creative services that will bring more business to your company.

objects.html_title: Co-op Advertising:  Local Business’ Long Lost Loot
objects.label: Co-op Advertising:  Local Business’ Long Lost Loot

meta.post_summary: Imagine you were strolling down a park sidewalk and out of the corner of your eye, you notice something floating through the air.  What first appears to be a large leaf turns out to be a single hundred-dollar bill!  As you approach the floating bill, you find there are more, drifting in your path. Following the trail of “Flying Benjamins,” you stumble upon a large stash of cash, buried within the brush. Next to the cash pile is a sign that reads, “Free money – sign up now.” A trove of abandoned money and an open invitation for free cash.  Would you just walk away?
meta.html_title: Co-op Advertising:  Local Business’ Long Lost Loot
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
Imagine you were strolling down a park sidewalk and out of the corner of your eye, you notice something floating through the air.  What first appears to be a large leaf turns out to be a single hundred-dollar bill!  As you approach the floating bill, you find there are more, drifting in your path. Following the trail of “Flying Benjamins,” you stumble upon a large stash of cash, buried within the brush. Next to the cash pile is a sign that reads, “Free money – sign up now.” A trove of abandoned money and an open invitation for free cash.  Would you just walk away? 

Unfortunately, this hypothetical scenario is an actuality for far too many local businesses that miss out on billions of dollars each year available to them through the various manufactures and vendors they supply via co-op advertising.  

Co-op advertising is a unique relationship between a particular manufacturer and a business owner that supplies their products.  The manufacturer from time-to-time will offer a determined amount of dollars for businesses to spend on advertising.  Business owners understand the necessity to advertise, even though their budgets may not allow for much.  This is where co-op advertising offers much reward.  

With co-op, the manufacturers are paying for advertising!  Despite this open handout, year after year vendors and manufactures discard these ignored funds that had been set aside for businesses to utilize for their advertising campaigns. And, these same businesses discard their chances to advertise and have their expenses reimbursed. 

For a vast majority of business owners, they are completely unaware that they even qualify for advertising funds through co-op avenues; and for many others, they simply don’t have the time to complete the tedious back-end paper work that goes into processing the co-op reimbursements. Regardless of the situation, unused advertising funds equals untapped customers who could have been exposed to products or services your business offers. 

But there is no problem without a viable solution, and when it comes to everything co-op, Advocate Digital Media is the answer.  Our in-house co-op experts handle everything from researching which manufactures are offering co-op dollars at any given time, to working with those manufactures to create approved ads, to processing all of the time-consuming leg work to get your money back.  We take on the tediousness of co-op advertising to allow business owners to focus on their day-to-day while at the same time taking full advantage of advertising on the manufacturers dime. 

Everyone dreams of stumbling upon a stash of cash for the taking, and for businesses, that cash is out there.  Start raiding the treasure chest of co-op advertising and never let the loot of co-op ads be lost again!

objects.html_title: Have you looked at your backend lately?
objects.label: Have you looked at your backend lately?

meta.post_summary: No, no, no, not that backend. I’m talking about your website’s backend. Have you ever heard of the terms PHP, Ruby, Java, Python, C, C#, C++, .NET, VB.NET, Go, Perl, Haskell, Lua, or ASP.NET?  In case you haven’t, those are some of the different kinds of programming languages along with a web framework that can be used to create and support the backend structure of a website. With so many options, it can seem difficult to know which language to use. To be fair, each one of the previously mentioned languages have their own strengths and merits. So why does Advocate Digital Media choose to use Python and PHP?
meta.html_title: Have you looked at your backend lately?
meta.meta_description: We do digital marketing with results that matter. From social media, web design, to digital advertising. We do it all.
meta.post_body:
No, no, no, not that backend. I’m talking about your website’s backend. Have you ever heard of the terms PHP, Ruby, Java, Python, C, C#, C++, .NET, VB.NET, Go, Perl, Haskell, Lua, or ASP.NET?  In case you haven’t, those are some of the different kinds of programming languages along with a web framework that can be used to create and support the backend structure of a website. With so many options, it can seem difficult to know which language to use. To be fair, each one of the previously mentioned languages have their own strengths and merits. So why does Advocate Digital Media choose to use Python and PHP? 

Well, we choose to use both languages to accomplish different solutions to your business’ challenge. Let's start with why we use PHP in conjunction with the Concrete5 content management system (CMS). PHP is a widely popular and supported language. Websites like Facebook, Wikipedia, Yahoo, Tumblr make use of the PHP web programming language. Due to the large support that PHP has, there are a plentiful amount of libraries and web solutions that our designers and developers can use to get your website up and running in a timely manner. Couple that with the Concrete5 CMS and you’ve got yourself a powerful and manageable website that our designers can update quickly with little cost to you.

If PHP sounds so perfect, why do we use Python as well? We use Python coupled with the Django Web Framework to create more unique and complex web solutions that require a lot of data, data organization, and calculations. This data can include things like large online inventories, customer data and tracking, and much more. Python is a programming language designed around being readable and easily maintainable. This benefits us and you because it allows our developers to rapidly develop a complex backend infrastructure for your custom website.
